Reviews.Title: “Grotty Dorm Meets Red Roof Inn”
Reviews.Author: sarahej
Reviews.Content: Used a Groupon (sucka!) that promised luxury spa getaway meets boutique hotel. Again - - gotcha sucka! The hotel is centrally located,actually great location that is close to Front St., downtown shopping, entertainment venues, etc. No complaints on that score. Groupon sold the deal with a $25 hotel credit to upgrade from a Zen suite to a Lotus suite. Sadly, as soon as the word groupon escaped our lips, the hotel was sold out for the night and we could not use the credit to upgrade -- unless we wanted the penthouse suite for $3500 a night. I wish that I had taken photos of our Zen suite, replete with stained Ikea Klippen sofa, because the notion of anything in the Cosmopolitan, short of a used car in their parking garage, being worth $3500 is insanely funny. The "suite" was really a dorm room with very dirty, dusty, yucky decor nods to new age/feng shui....two water features with bamboo (and algae!)...a yoga mat that I would not use without a round of penicillin....and empty wine bottles as design. Thoughtfully, the management had loaded the CD player with something that sounded like the music/bird sounds they play when you are getting a massage. Also interesting were the slightly Scientology looking literature/pamphlets on finding your inner healthy child that were left on the tv stand but could be purchased at checkout for $19.95. We looked for Yanni, Ramtha and Linda Evans in the closet but couldn't find them. We faced a rooftop exhaust system so all the yoga and incense in the world would not have made this serene or tranquil. Congratulations to the Cosmopolitan (and Groupon) for zapping us for $159.

Reviews.Title: “Could Be Better”
Reviews.Author: jtml0802
Reviews.Content: My husband and I thought the Cosmopolitan was okay. It was in a relatively convenient location close to the subway and the bed was comfortable. But the biggest issue? We came back to our room one day and noticed the door wasn't closed all the way (slightly opened, the door had not "clicked" close). When we noticed and opened the door, we thought maybe housekeeping was there, but they were not. We then inquired downstairs at the front desk and they said housekeeping had just finished our room recently. They must not have closed the door all the way by accident. That is a pretty big accident. Luckily, we did not have any valuables lying around. Furthermore, we didn't think the room was that well kept either. There was definitely dust balls in the hidden areas and the furniture seemed a bit worn out. Another thing to mention is that upon arrival, front desk had asked us what incense we would like for our turn-down service, so we checked "lilac." However, during our whole stay, we never got this incense at all. At check out, we mentioned it and they offered to give us some "to go." We would probably opt to try another hotel if we visit Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Needs upkeep and a good cleaning”
Reviews.Author: montrealtraveller
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a quick one night stay at the Cosmopolitan Toronto- I travel frequently to the city and have been curious to try it out-as its well situated and I always enjoy a boutique hotel experience. I was well in a nutshell-very underwhelmed. Apart from the good service by the front desk staff and Valet-the Cosmo comes up way short. I stayed in room ONE on the 20th floor-which features a very strange layout, and really could not accommodate more than 1 adult. The hotel seems to lack in basic upkeep- The rooms have been furnished with what comes across as cheap imported furniture-and they are really showing wear and tear-and really not up to a 3 star rating- The cleanliness also is very concerning-the room was definitely surfaced clean-and my socks were covered in dust after simply unpacking- The room features a very nice shower-but again has not been kept up-and there was very obvious mould and mildew all over the tiles –I had checked in during the evening and only noticed this in the am-or I would have requested another room right away. Also encountered issues with the TV and phone system-both did not work- I had really hoped to like Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “FAB location and service”
Reviews.Author: krmz
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel ..Jasmine front desk clerk, wonderful. All staff went out of their way to make your stay feel "boutiquey and cozy" I had the most wonderful 2 nights in a hotel bar that I have ever had in a one prior, it was so fun to hang out there after a day exploring the city. Eight the wine bar was so fun. Chris never left a drink unfilled or a request not met. The location is superb for making your way around Toronto..Loved the suite set up of the rooms. Even in the elevator the supervisor of rooms asked us unsolicited how we enjoyed our room, very concerned about your stay and comfort. This will be our go to hotel on our many visits to Toronto. Thanks for a wonderful time.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: eddibow
Reviews.Content: Just off Yonge Street in Toronto, is this small hotel that we quite enjoyed. The hotel has only valet parking which uses an elevator to shuttle your car to the parking deck. The room was spacious, not luxurious by any means. However, it had a microwave, small stove, small dishwasher, washer and dryer, etc. So, while we did not partake in using all of these items on an overnight stay, those on a longer stay may find the items beneficial. 2 tv's; queen size bed; glassed in shower complete the tasteful and functional room. An alternative to a "big box" chain of hotels. We enjoyed the stay. I think you will too.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Zen!”
Reviews.Author: 1000islandgirlx
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel! I don't know where to start. Great service, spotless rooms and a wonderful attention to detail. Yoga mats, a trickleing fountain with a salt stone, turn down service that includes a different meditation stone every night and a beautiful selection of incense to calm you. The Shizen Spa has numerous services but you have to try the Shizen signature massage. Go....you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms greatly exceeded my expectations”
Reviews.Author: ramblingsalesman
Reviews.Content: I'm writing this review while lounging on the leather couch sipping a cup of coffee in the room. We selected the "tranquility suite" which is a 1 bedroom with a living room, kitchen and an awesome bathroom. Room is spotless and modern with a fountain if you can believe it. Two flat panel tv's and very tastefully decorated. Really in a market where even a basic room costs you 120 bucks this place is a bargain at 146.00 a night. Don't use their parking, its very expensive and will not fit a full size truck. Street parking is free from 9 pm to 8 am if you can find a spot. There are other lots within a block which are much cheaper as well. Overall very very impressed with the rooms in this chic boutique condo esk type hotel. Will be back for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest, but not bad at all.”
Reviews.Author: BrownLibra
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through a Groupon as we were watching a concert downtown and didn't want to drive back to the burbs. The customer service was great here. The lobby is kind of small, but has a boutiquey vibe. Our room didn't have the greatest view, but that wasn't really a problem as we got there at night. I found the room clean and boutiquey, but thought that the tv was in an awkward position (couldn't watch it from the bed, etc.). It was also in a weird position in regards to the chairs. The kitchen was cool but very very small. I found the bathroom to be very clean, which is quite important to me. I also really liked hearing jazz music when we walked in (there was just a radio set to a jazz station)...it was a small and simple touch but it really lent itself to the boutiquey downtown vibe. However, we didn't get incense -- something about checking in too late. No biggie but I was a touch disappointed. Not a real problem. They allowed us to have late checkout and that is that. A great hotel but again, parking was too much. And the hotel is a little 'hidden' from the main roads, which may be a good or bad thing depending on the individual.

Reviews.Title: “Meh...”
Reviews.Author: tashsolo
Reviews.Content: Don't be fooled by the pictures.. My boyfriend and I stayed here this weekend and it was alright.. Nothing special.. The decor was plain, the furnitures were dinged all over and the room and linens smelt so musty.. The rooms were just surfaced cleaned.. underneath the bed and other areas were so dusty.. The size of the televisions were sadly soo small! And also !! I don't know if this is common, but this is the first hotel that I've been to that does cleaning 6 o'clock in the evening!! We went down to the spa and were extremely surprised that when we came back, our bed was made but the pillows were not put back in place :/ and also there was a sign that you place outside of the door if you want your room cleaned and we didn't put ours out :s.. weird But I will let people know that they have gotten rid of their mildew issue. the washroom was clean..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: trip-trippin
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Cosmo for one night during the weekend. I found the reception staff to be exceptionally friendly and helpful with the questions I had about the area and things to do. I was in the city to mainly shop and the hotel was within easy walking distance to the Eaton Centre, which had plenty of shopping to keep me busy for the day. I booked the regular or Zen room which was much nicer than I anticipated. With the separate little kitchen area and the bed area off kind of around the corner it was like a bachelor apartment. I had one full wall of windows, the view wasn't great but it was nice light and one wall of with half windows with a better view. The bathroom was small but nice, very clean and modern like with a very large shower and good water pressure. The toiletries were nice and towels large and plush. My only complaint about the hotel was that I didn't have any dishcloths in my little kitchen. There was dishwasher but I still would have like some towels and clothes to wipe down the counters. Also I kept having issues with my key card, which you need to operate the elevator as well as to get into your room. I went to the spa for a few treatments which were nice, but the girls seemed a little less experienced than other places I have been to, and the prices were somewhat steep. All in all those it was a very nice stay and I would definitely go back again.Location was great and the bed was comfortable, what more can you ask for...oh maybe cheaper parking.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: maclab
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on December 30, 2011. The staff at reception couldn't have been more helpful. Our suite on the 16th floor was large, spotlessly clean, and very comfortable. The bed was very comfortable and the bathroom was bright and airy. Everything appeared very new and the toiletries in the bathroom were first class. Our only problem was that the bathroom door had a loud squeak which I am sure would have become annoying had we been staying longer than one night. We did report it to the staff the next morning. We had dinner in the wine bar because we were given a discount coupon. We were not disappointed at all with the meal. The continental breakfast the next morning was adequate with a variety of bread, muffins and fruit but we would have prefered more choices of cereals instead of Rice Crispies. Overall, it was a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: redmud
Reviews.Content: This was a 4-star hotel we booked in an expensive location for a 3 star price. At the end of the stay, I would surmise this hotel is 3-3.5 stars regardless of price. Pros: Large space â€“ feels like staying at someoneâ€™s small 1 bedroom apartment with 3 distinct rooms (bedroom, kitchen/living, and bathroom). Great location Comfortable bed Cons: The rooms/hallways smell a bit moldy. As other reviewers have mentioned, the bathrooms have noticeable mildew etc in the showers. Itâ€™s supposed to be a boutique hotel, but really itâ€™s just a converted apartment building that dimmed the lights in the elevators and hallways so you canâ€™t see details, like dings, dents, worn carpet. The walls are thin so you do hear your neighbours and people in the hallway. I shot out of bed at 3am one morning when someone was knocking on my neighbourâ€™s door, even with my bedroom door closed within the apartment. Linens are of poor quality (bedding mostly) Everything wasnâ€™t exactly spic and span â€“ when I first walked into my bedroom, I could immediately see a heavy pile of dust on the nightstand next to the bed, an obvious location to clean. I ran my finger down the table and came away with a grey pile on my finger. Who knows what else was not cleaned properly. Front desk staff was not especially friendly. Internet is not included â€“ what century is this? They are in the heart of the financial district of Canada, and internet is an additional charge of $20/day. The business center charges $0.50/min, more than the most expensive cities in Europe. Overall, itâ€™s a decent hotel in a good location for a good price. I donâ€™t think I would recommend this hotel to friends, and likely wonâ€™t stay here again though as you can get a better hotel for a slightly higher price elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “For the price and location, an excellent choice for multiday travellers to Downtown”
Reviews.Author: Martin_Hy
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for a seminar that was taking place at the exchange center. My original criteria for selecting the cosmo was that it was a 4 star with strong reviews and very close to everything. I will describe the aspects of this hotel in such a way that anyone skimming this review can likely jump to what is important. The room: I was in a Zen Suite (their cheapest room). This room was MUCH bigger than i expected. a fully functional kitchenette, living room, decent and clean washroom and a very decently sized bedroom. The bed was excellent. The washer and dryer was a surprise. The living room was nice enough that I entertained friends one evening (and actually cooked up something for them). The bathroom was very bright and clean, but the toilet could have used some maintenance. I did not really have a view on the 11th floor (except into the opposing office building... and they could likely see me very well as well), but this just is not an issue for me. If anyone else needs a view, specifically request a room near the top of the hotel. One thing to note, I would not call this room child friendly. It is definitely geared towards adults (modern, simple, elegant). In addition, the sound proofing was not the best. I expect that if you bring children, it will in fact be you disturbing other clients. This again was not an issue for me but should be considered. Location: If you are planning to walk, it is a great spot. Minutes from most anything in the core downtown. The road was not easy to get to by car because of construction, and I am told this is not uncommon, and parking (should you need it) is not cheap... about $35/night (I flew in). First Impressions: When you first walk in, it is somewhat claustrophobic in the entrance area. VERY small. The hallways too. As a result, I started out with a weak impression of what this stay will be like. I felt much better when I found my room. Staff: Extremely nice and helpful. A newspaper at my door every morning, and everyone seemed to genuinely enjoy working at this hotel. Makes for a nice change. I was a bit thrown off by women coming in the evening with incense or other aroma items, but it is a spa'ish/zen'ish hotel, and it fits with the theme. Overall, it was certainly more than I expected, and if I need to stay downtown for multiple days, I will certainly use this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “It got from bad to worse”
Reviews.Author: Queen_Marg0t
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel on November 11 for one night. I booked it with Quickbook because they offered a great rate of 129.00. When we were checking in, the hotel had us booked at $159.00 and promised to correct the error. I should not have been suprised that when we were checking out, I was charged the higher rate and it took a while to ensure that I got my credit card refunded on the spot. We encountered incompetence and sloppy service throughout our stay including waiting for slippers for an hour and returning to the front desk several times because rooms cards were not working. But the worst of it came several days later when I checked my credit card statement and found out that were were charged over $40.00 for wine and chocolate that were not even in the room as alcohol was locked in the fridge. I won't repeat what other reviewers said about the accommodations but they are not comfortable or zen. Bathroom tiles were not cleaned in a while, floors were dusty so you could not work without shoes, and sofa was not big enough for 2 people to sit comfortably. We booked this hotel because of its location and positive reviews but I can't recommend my experience to anyone. We travel a fair bit, and don't place unreasonable demands on places where we stay, but this stay was the worst.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodating Staff, Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: Jesse G
Reviews.Content: I was originally booked in for two nights which I prepaid online through the hotel's website. It was a visit for leisure, so location (while being central was important, where in the downtown I was was not) wasn't a primary concern. However, the location was excellent as well. The entrance to the hotel is on a side street, and while the reception area is rather intimate, the quality of service and the quality and size of the rooms made up for it. Who really hangs out in the lobby, anyway? I was only able to stay one of the nights I'd intended as my dog escaped from where we had boarded him which meant I had to travel home to join the search, but my one night was enough to absolutely ensure my return. Upon learning of my predicament, the front desk staff went ahead and issued me a partial refund - even without my having requested any refund - and expressed their sincere concern. It was excellent treatment that left me with the impression they truly valued my business. I have recommended this hotel to others, and will continue to do so. I look forward to my next stay here!

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: 00truth
Reviews.Content: great hotel - has everything you need friendly environment - with a city like Toronto you can (if you feel fit enough) walk length and width - i never used the spa, it looked OK but I just liked the feel of the place, just so central...

Reviews.Title: “Dirty bathroom tainted our stay”
Reviews.Author: Evan293
Reviews.Content: Returning to the Cosmpolitan after a few years, we expected the same quality we had experienced before. Unfortunately, the quality has declined. We were shocked by the amount of mildew growing in the shower. This amount of mold is what you might expect at a YMCA or public shower but not at a boutique hotel. Note to management: a small amount of bleach kills mildew. After immediately complaining and showing the front desk rep, he showed me two other rooms which were equally accentuated with moldy showers. We picked the least moldy and tried to bear it. I am uploading pictures that really do not quite illustrate the level of uncleanliness but give you a pretty good idea. Also, when returning to the hotel on a Saturday night at 10pm, we wanted to have a glass of wine at the bar but were told it was a $10 cover for each of us because there was an event. Even when we explained we were staying at the hotel, we were told it did not matter. Hotel Fail. Get it together, Cosmopolitan management, or your friendly staff will be out of jobs when you close your doors.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE THIS BOUTIQUE HOTEL!!!!”
Reviews.Author: frequentflyer176
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times and have never had anything but rave reviews for this place! The rooms are trendy, clean and comfortable, and the wine bar is exceptional! The location is good - you are a short walk from Union station, Eaton Center, the Hockey Hall of Fame, MTCC, CBC...stay here and enjoy the luxuries of a boutique hotel with great staff and a great attitude!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff, but all else just average.”
Reviews.Author: cog480
Reviews.Content: The staff was amazingly friendly and helpful. I enjoyed talking with them, and had I not had business dinners every night I would have taken their restaurant suggestions. The room, while not dated in terms of decor, was a little tired. The kitchenette's counter was formica, and parts of it were peeling off- one piece popped off when I brushed against it. I was displeased that I had to pay for wi-fi - an additional $12/day. I thought the price was quite high for not including this service. It did have nice touches, like relaxation CD's, a bathroom, and nice toiletries. I went to the lounge there - 8? - and it was fine - the drinks were well-priced.

Reviews.Title: “Ask to have the fridge emptied on your first day”
Reviews.Author: Tabithay23
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well situated near Yonge, 10 min, was to the train station. The rooms have a built in kitchenette, a closed bedroom and washer/dryer ensuite which are great features. The service, although very friendly was lacking however. First off, I asked for the email of their spa to inquire about services and make appointments and was given an erroneous email. Then, although their website promoted the availability of a yoga mat in each room (which was great since I was to try out a few classes in Toronto), there was none in the room. I told the front desk about this and although they told me they would look to see if there was a spare one they could find, they never got back to me. They did however fix the blinds which I had trouble with. When I got home, I saw on my credit card statement that they had charged me $4.80 for something, but never received an invoice detailing the charges. I emailed them and was told that it was because I used laundry detergent (which did not have a price tag on it showing that it was not complementary) and an orange juice. As I had done some grocery shopping beforehand, I was sure I never took one of their juices. When I asked the charge to be reversed, they never wrote back. Lesson learned - always ask the front desk to empty any kitchenette refrigerator when checking-in. A lot of construction was going on at the time on the street so sleeping in was a little difficult, that is of course, totally out of the control of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “SMOKE AND MIRRORS”
Reviews.Author: Piereus
Reviews.Content: After checking in we had very high expectations about this boutique hotel, and when we got in the room the impression was still high. That was the best moment in our two days long stay. Lucky for us to get in Beautiful Toronto in a very warm fall, Heating was noisy as hell. Air purifier was the same, but smelled as NY City air. The Bathroom and bathrobe: dirty and moldy tiles in the shower cabin, the door can't stay close, and this makes the pretty good furniture completely secondary. Bathrobe was cheap and worn out, and this is unacceptable for a almost 500 bucks per night. WALLS AND SOUNDPROOFING: IT'S ABSOLUTELY USELESS TO HAVE A RELAXATION STICK INCENSE WHEN YOU GOT THIN-LIKE-PAPER WALLS!!! From the balcony or from the room you could hear anything from your neighbor. Last thing: I called the reception to know if I from international phone card i could have been charged. Even though i was assured it was free, they were not. We're not rich, but we don't complain for 4 miserable dollars. It's about clarity, not for the money. LAST BUT NOT LEAST, ROOM ARRANGEMENT AND LINEN: Cheap linen, worn out. on my side there was a hole fixed with an iron patch, pathetic... The arrangement was approximated, from the bed to the cleaning in itself. As soon as we can again in Toronto, never again in Cosmopolitan...

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Experience!”
Reviews.Author: LUX555
Reviews.Content: Got engaged in Toronto, loved The Cosmopolitan. Felt like apartment living. Super small room the first 2 nights, then got upgraded to a deluxe suite our last night. :) Concierge sent up chocolate covered strawberries for our engagement. BIANCA and MELISA are awesome. They gave us the best food recommendations- Toronto can get their food ON!! Close to King's station (super clean subway system) and very walkable city. We are going back over holiday in December and absolutely staying here. We Loved it!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient boutique hotel in downtown area”
Reviews.Author: Bermudabye
Reviews.Content: Sells a Zen-like tranquillity, and it probably is. Nice spacious room, very polite and helpful staff, comfortable bed, and slightly off the main drag, so a bit quieter. Balconies aren't for sitting on, but being able to open a window makes a nice change from the normal corporate hotel. Easy walking distance from 'the Bay', and the Eaton Center for shopping. Continental breakfast uninspiring.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Chuc
Reviews.Content: Awsome suite with great view after asking for upgrade to unit facing south on 25th floor. Had booked a Zen suite on 24 th floor. Was ok but with no view because unit was on nwc. Clealiness of unit and other facilities left to be desired. (mold in shower and sweat stained exercise equipment in small gym)Overall great fun stay. Would go back

Reviews.Title: “Expensive Boutique”
Reviews.Author: JeffandFaithR
Reviews.Content: I'm now convinced that Boutique = Small + Expensive! We stayed 2 nights at almost Â£200 a night. This was poor value for money. Our 11th floor 'suite' was surrounded by brick walls and didn't even have a view of the street. The Queen bed was shoe-horned into a corner of the room and who needs a washing machine and dish-washer for a short stay? After paying through the nose you then find that everything is extra, from Wi-Fi to the bottle of water by the bedside. On a positive note, the front desk staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with no Wardrobe”
Reviews.Author: maturegappers
Reviews.Content: We arrived in our deluxe suite and looked around to unpack and found there was no wardrobe (closet) I rang reception and they just said to use the drawers! There was a washing machine, an ironing board but not one hanger. Deluxe to this hotel means basic. I complained about the lack of closet while in reception just as a number of other people were checking in and they said they would try to get us moved (first by upgrading us for $40 per night). We got moved the next day to an identical room, but with a small closet, but it really tainted the start of our holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel in the heart of Toronto, Canada”
Reviews.Author: DB/ole
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after seeing a well known circus that was at the Port lands. It was close by and yet near the heart of one of Toronto's appealing districts. We were so surprised to find a suite with so many ammenities, perfect for both couples and business travellers. We used the winebar/dining room on a friday night when the wines were 1$ an ounce- and the appetizers we chose just perfect. The next day we were walking distance to the famous St.Lawrence market- and really enjoyed the offerings there. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to all my friends, as the service and room were just perfect, and the tariff appropriate.

Reviews.Title: “The best mix of business-oriented and relaxation”
Reviews.Author: xavo
Reviews.Content: I never thought booking a room in a hotel in busy downtown Toronto would grant me a relaxing experience during a fast-paced work trip. Yet the Cosmopolitan made it happen. The staff was incredibly helpful and attentive. The rooms had everything one possibly need away from home. They are truly worth what you pay; in part it's the decor, which in and of itself makes you feel you are entering an oasys and leaving a meeting-packed day behind. Breakfast includes a great variety of items to choose from. I did not get to try their spa, but if it's even half as good as the rest of their service, no doubt it will be amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Consistlently Impressive”
Reviews.Author: Gauchowest
Reviews.Content: With each visit to Toronto, I like it more. Very dynamic, business-focused and happening. I've had the pleasure to stay at the Cosmopolitan a few times, and my most recent visit this August, I continued to be impressed. First off, the hotel rate was very fair for a city that has little vacany, service at check in was friendly and professional, and the room was fresh and lovely. This is not a new hotel, and the room was not sparkling, but it was clean, and had the same attention to detail I found years earlier. Kitchenette and washer/dryer was a lovely touch. I did not visit the Shizen Spa (to my dismay), but did catch a quick workout in the cramped but functional gym. Wine bar was lovely, and the breakfast buffet provided me with the right fuel to get my day started in the city. Lots of great restaurants and bars in the area. Using the stairs before and after my workout, I did not like the fact the hotel uses the stairwell as storage. In addition to a fire hazard, its not safe for guests. Other than, that, a wonderful experience. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, more like staying at an apartment than hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hrmefs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel over Labor Day weekend - in one of the Zen suites. It was a very nice hotel, but our bathroom could have used some cleaning/renovating. The bed wasn't too comfortable. But we got a great deal and the staff was very nice. We loved their spa! And their location is also great - right in the heart of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “I always stay here when in Toronto”
Reviews.Author: ShawnaByers
Reviews.Content: Love this place! Have stayed here many times while on business in Toronto. Excellent suite hotel ideally situated in the financial district downtown. Close to restaurants, subway, harbor front and St. Lawrence market. Service and staff are top notch. Rooms have good beds, upscale amenities and offer a kitchenette, great for a preparing a quick breakfast or late night snack.

Reviews.Title: “We loved the Cosmopolitan!!”
Reviews.Author: iwanttogo
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Cosmopolitan (9/4 and 9/5). Although our trip was short we had a wonderfult time. We loved the hotel and the zen like feel of the room. What made the hotel extra special was Bianca. All hotels should have a Bianca. You go girl!!!

Reviews.Title: “Zen in the core”
Reviews.Author: ATjohnpapa
Reviews.Content: I held a birthday party in one of the suites at the Cosmopolitan after staying there on a whim months earlier. The location is ideal, directly across the street from the King St. Subway station and walking distance to pretty much everything you need. I liked the Zen feel of the hotel, piping soft music through the halls and in the elevators, as well as the evening turn down service that included incense and a healing stone. (I got amethyst both times) Each room has it's own balcony, some with views of Lake Ontario and the downtown core. The suite I stayed in had a fairly spacious living room with hardwood laminate, a kitchenette with island and desk space. I comfortably entertained almost a dozen people there for sushi and drinks before heading out to a local pub. (C'est What? A 2 min. walk south) It really felt like a rental condo, and since my stay they have converted some of the rooms to condo units, so be mindful of that when booking. They also have a tough time keeping restaurants in the main floor space (there have been three that I know of) so I can't speak for the current state of the room service, but when I was there, it was hot and quick and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service, we'll definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: Totally Happy X
Reviews.Content: I live in Toronto and my fiance lives in Ottawa. He planned an entire 'proposal weekend' for us in Toronto while in Ottawa using just his phone, and lucky for me, Cosmopolitan Hotel was part of that weekend! They catered to all his requests, gave him personalized service, and made our stay there wonderful (all the little details go a long way!). The suite was fantastic, the food at Eight Wine Bar was delicious, and I would highly recommend it to anyone, especially couples.

Reviews.Title: “A small place that left a big impression”
Reviews.Author: OMoralez22
Reviews.Content: The location was great because it was downtown in the center of all the activity and conveniently located to many attractions. The hotel is also located on a quiet side street that provided a nice getaway from all the great distractions when we were ready to wind down. The service was great and the staff were extremely nice and helpful. The best thing we liked was that the room was very nice and certainly more than we expected with a small living room, kitchen and personal laundry room. The nightly "treats" were nice too. The things we liked least were that parking was a little expensive and the workout room was very small and cramped. Overall, we were very impressed with the hotel and the people and will definitely stay there again on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Chic Hotel with Exceptional Customer Service!”
Reviews.Author: tcd_11
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan exceeded our expectations in every way. The hotel was beautiful, very modern and chic. The staff was exceptional in ensuring all of our needs were met, especially Bianca who catered to our every request from check in to check out, she made us feel as if we were VIP guests! The hotel is amazing and we definitely plan to stay here next year during Caribana weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location, great service”
Reviews.Author: I10driver
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a little hard to find as it is on a small side street but very close to all the action on Yonge. We were on a baseball trip to see the Bluejays with my son. The hotel is kept up very well and the room seemed newly updated and very clean. It had a intown apartment kind of feel. It was roomy and comfortable with a kitchen and washer/dryer. The spa was great. Had a nice massage. We did not try the resturaunt. There were so many other food options around we never got to try it or room service. It's only 2 blocks fromt the Hockey hall of fame and maybe a mile or little more from the CN tower, the BlueJays stadium, and theatre district.

Reviews.Title: “Your Local Apartment”
Reviews.Author: gridskipper
Reviews.Content: I've never had an experience quite like my stay at the Cosmopolitan. From the moment I stepped into the room, it felt like I was living in an apartment. I'm not exactly sure how they achieve this, but it helped that the layout of my room felt very natural, and that it took all of two seconds to walk past the lobby. I loved how quiet everything was, the stellar view I had, but mostly the sheer comfort of it all. My stay was not perfect, of course. Internet access was expensive and slow during the evening. I was also surprised that a warning about a late-night water shutoff wasn't accompanied by a free bottle or water. Wouldn't that have made all the difference? Still, all I needed out of my stay was a quiet place to work and unwind, and the Cosmopolitan paid off in spades -- at a very reasonable rate, in a stellar location, and with excellent room service to boot. A well

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Kurtchel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmo after our wedding and we were disappointed, especially after paying the price that we did. The air conditioning was barely working. We turned it to the lowest temperature (60 F) and it couldn't have gotten cooler than 80F. The bed was also not very comfortable. Just wished the bed had been better and the air had actually worked. Didn't sleep well because of the temp issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in the heart of downtown Toronto”
Reviews.Author: zimchic_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel was situated close to Eaton Centre, subway stations, great restaurants and a Bikram Yoga studio- which i frequented on a great introductory offer. The rooms are spacious, with small kitchenette and washer/dryer. The best part was one of their receptionists, Bianca, who was so helpful and gave me hints and tips so my experience of Toronto was that much better. I had a great holiday, felt relaxed and got to do some yoga too! Would definitely go back and would recommend anyone to stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Do NOT go here! (Restaurant and bar)”
Reviews.Author: sweet1_11
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend (both persons of colour and educated) and I were given two "free drink" coupons so we thought we would check the place out. As soon as we got there it was evident that noone was particularly fond of serving us. At the bar, I gave the bartender my coupons and he gave us two drinks. (which were supposedly "free"...I then ordered a meal. I have never been so humiliated in my life. Our food was brought to us in a paper bag and we were not given plates, condiments or utensils. I then kindly asked for a plate. What I received were two saucers meant for placing under teacups. Suffice it to say I then asked for the bill, paid and left the 'paper bagged" food on the table. I would not recommend this restaurant (and hotel since I'm assuming I would be treated the same way) We honestly felt like we were not their preferred clientele.

Reviews.Title: “great”
Reviews.Author: William68_11
Reviews.Content: Love it. Everyone was so nice to me and they were all so helpful. I didnt know my way around but they showed me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ShelleyEdwards
Reviews.Content: I have been staying here a minimum of once a month for the past six months.The staff are incredible - Melissa and Bianca at the front desk, all of the valet staff, housekeeping who leave incents in the room - it's an upgraded home away from home! The insuite laundry is a bonus on longer business trips!

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubbish82
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a suite on our wedding night. The staff were attentive and helpful. The room itself was nice - spacious, clean, and well decorated. The washroom was a bit tired, and the shower could have been cleaned better. At checkout, there was a slight disagreement about a charge on our account, but the hotel management handled it very well, and resolved the issue quickly and appropriately. We would return!

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable and impressive service from Reception, Room Service and all staff .”
Reviews.Author: Verity2011
Reviews.Content: I live partly in London and partly in the South of France and have stayed at many 5* hotels all over the world. The service of the staff at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Toronto was second to none. Whatever we required for the room arrived immediately and all our inquiries at the Reception desk were handled with friendliness, efficiency, and grace. Mrs K

Reviews.Title: “See Bianca with her beautiful smile :-)”
Reviews.Author: MarieetCarmel
Reviews.Content: I recommend this Hotel, it's very quiet and Zen. Thank you, the service is verry good

Reviews.Title: “Amazing wedding night”
Reviews.Author: angelmode11
Reviews.Content: At first i was not sure about the reviews some people wrote about this hotel well i gave it i try and i'm sorry but i had such an amazing time such first class costumer service bed was comfortable room was edgy classy relaxing balcony kitchen etc. an order of a bottle of champaign .....perfect for my wedding night! Now i plan to go back but this time spa and hotel loved this hotel thank you for making my day memorable :) Thania

Reviews.Title: “Such an elegant hotel and such surly service...”
Reviews.Author: SundeepK
Reviews.Content: The hotel's location, just off the happening King and Yong Street and a 2 minute walk from the nearest metro station, is great. Inside, once I had navigated beyond the pint-sized lobby and reception area, the room with a built-in kitchenette was elegantly done up and really aesthetic. The incense sticks add to the zen like feeling it generated but the view from the windows, the back of another building spoilt the effect. The service is rather poor for a 4-star hotel and those manning the reception were either put off by my appearance or seemed to prefer other guests. The buffet breakfast at the poky little restaurant was a disaster. Afer waiting around an eternity for my eggs to come, I just went to the much more friendly Under the Over, just across the street from the next day on. There are some nice things about this hotel but the poor service of the staff left such a poor taste in my mouth that I wouldn't go back in a hurry particularly since there are much better hotels in the vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again...should have listen to the reviews!”
Reviews.Author: staceylee1
Reviews.Content: Started off my $99.00 a night booking turned into over $350.00 a night....thank god I only booked one night!...I don't mind spending the money if its worth it! Entire room was smaller than my own bedroom.....the whole thing they are trying to portray as being a Zen hotel.......ha.....nice try.....the aurora is stagnant.....the service stinks and the food from Eight was terrible. Second night I went to a four star......slept and ate like a queen....and spent less!?....?....Should have listened to the reviews I had read previously.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, efficient but not cozy.”
Reviews.Author: CAGOttawa_Canada
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a small studio suite (government rate which generally means the least desirable room in a hotel). I really appreciated some aspects: a nice little kitchen, housekeeping ran the dishwasher every day and re-stocked amenities, wood floors, nice shower. The hotel is situated in a high rise building on a side street but is very close to the St. Lawerence Market and has easy access to all downtown neighbourhoods and the Eaton Centre. Some drawbacks: could only watch TV from a small arm chair - no couch and could not see TV from the bed, no tub to soak in. The bed was fine but there was something odd about the bedding, it didn't fit the bed properly and I had to continually re-make it myself. Oddly, housekeeping but did not put the ironing board and iron away. It was an efficient little space but not really comfortable. I am a frequent business traveller but somehow couldn't quite feel at home here.

Reviews.Title: “Gone downhill..Was my favourite place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: tankgirl243
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend have stayed at this hotel many times before. We decided to stay over the valentines weekend for our 5 year anniversary. So first off: The rooms are great ,but they have started to lack in quality since the first time staying , such as: +every room used to have an air purifier, I noticed they got rid of that. + the room we booked said it would have 2-,27 inch T.V's (I know that sounds excessive but I needed my glasses to see the the only T.V in the room so that kinda sucked) + Now EVERYTIME we go anywhere we put the tag on the door, so that they DO NOT come in the room, we don't want our room cleaned ever or people near our stuff. So we put the tag on the door and went out for the day, when we got back it seemed our room was half cleaned..bed was made, new towels-but old towels were left, and house coats still pilled in the room. + When we went out on the saturday night suddenly my boyfriends car that was taken by the valet the night before has a completely new noise to it (like a broken coil). Those can happen anytime, but it definitely wasn't making that noise on our hour drive in, so it was just kinda weird. +When we came back to the hotel on saturday night, ( we had decided to come back to eight bar- so he can have a drink) when we walked up to the bar , it was packed and there was a great dance flood happening- Problem was it was a PRIVATE party on the saturday of valentines weekend. That sucked. so we went to our room on floor 9 Room 905 and could hear the music from the dance floor until around 2 am . so we couldn't enjoy the club ,only be annoyed by it. + lastly when checking out I told the man that last time they billed us they messed up and charged us for breakfast (which comes with the CAA package)...he said don't worry its covered- then handed us a bill with $33 parking. I had to point out (like every time I have stayed there) that with the CAA package it says parking is discounted rate of $20. he then said "oh the promos over, is that still up on the site" <--- and yeah I think it has been since we first stayed here like 4 years ago. anyway. bad stay. I don't think we will stay here again. maybe their sister hotel the Pantages (if that's still all right - the rooms were way bigger anyway and its closer to the mall) P.S for anyone thinking about going in the Spa hot tub its $15 per day. the kitchenettes are good, and theres no free WIFI.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER NEVER AGAIN!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: vncforte19
Reviews.Content: Short and sweet......nice hotel....but on a 2 day stay we were charged 516 dollars in unexplained charges!!!! I will follow up on this but left because no one could explain. I work in a company of 5000 in Niagara Falls and will do my best to let as many as I can know about this. DISGUSTED and in shock still. Can not figure what we were charged for. We only had 4 pops and one water so no idea. First nite maid walked in without knocking as well I dont need to explain what we were doing but shocked us. Then next nite Wine Bar closed...on VALENTINE WEEKEND!!! Great thinking on the food and beverage department for this. So more money to cabs since we had no choice but to leave. Just terrible overall and in shock.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but has gone downhill a bit”
Reviews.Author: goldengirl217
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here multiple times and feel that the quality is starting to go downhill, especially in the bathrooms. We stayed in a studio suite and last time we stayed in one we had a small living area in our room. Not this time and it was very tight and made the kitchen almost useless when there was nowhere to eat in the room. The tiles in the shower desperately need to be redone or cleaned - they appear very dirty and old. It is still a decent hotel, nice lobby and restaurant area, but it is starting to show it's age from renovations done probably 10 years ago and could really stand an update. It is in a great location however - right off Younge St and very near St Lawrence Market. Also - the lack of fitness center and free wi-fi is a turnoff.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, beautiful and fun.”
Reviews.Author: Diane K
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cosmo for a few days and I have to say we could not have had a better experience! The rooms are beautiful and you have a small kitchen for snacks so you don't have to leave the room all the time. We told them it was our anniversary and they put us up on a high floor with a view of the CN tower. It was beautiful. Turndown service with incense was a really nice touch coming home from dinner every night. The restaurant food and drinks were also wonderful and we had the friendliest bartender. We were also close to many restaurants, shopping and entertainment. Spa on site!!! I am a very picky traveller with high standards, and I do believe in spending the money for good accomodations. This was one of the best hotel experiences we've ever had. Worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT CHOICE”
Reviews.Author: Sunseeker_mtl
Reviews.Content: First time in this hotel, the night before was at the Royal York and I can tell it is a huge difference much better and more modern I booked through Tablet hotels and as a privilege member got some extras as free internet (was working very well) and upgrade to deluxe suite I stayed in one bedroom suite (number3) it is huge with kitchen and having the bedroom and a living room separated it is great ,a lot of light and sun from huge windows very good sleep TVs in the bedroom as well and living room feel at home Bathroom shower spa and good size if we compare to hotel same category The breakfast is continental they should offer eggs...even with a supplement I have tried the bar and got something to eat average and small menu Hotel close by Eaton center 5 minutes walking and to eat The Marche very convenient. Gym small but few machines to work out I should suggest that the jaccuzi of the spa should be free of charge Lady came at night to put some encens nice touch Check in and check out efficient Definetely will come back here after tried The intercontinental and the Fairmont not as nice

Reviews.Title: “A disappointment”
Reviews.Author: AussieAbroad000
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Cosmopolitan after a wonderful experience a couple of years ago, but it was a disappointment this time. While the hotel is nicely decorated, the following items disappointed us. - slow drain in the shower caused an overflow onto the floor and into the room after only 4 min of use. We reported to the front desk, but no one came to fix it after three nights. - plug for washbasin did not work - on the last night, our bed was not made up - they just pulled the duvet over the unmade sheets. It made us feel that they did not care about their guests. I placed all this on their feedback card and hopefully they will learn from it, but don't think I will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option for Downtown Stay, Nice Extras”
Reviews.Author: laurengucsb
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at this hotel in November and was happy with the stay. The rooms, while not overly spacious, are apartment-style, which I didn't realize when I booked. I didn't use the kitchen at all, but in the bed area, there was enough room in the hallway for me to do yoga -- I really liked that they had a yoga mat in the closet. The closet was mini -- not sure 2 people could share if they were there for longer than a few days, especially with coats and stuff. The service was pretty good. Check in and check out were fine and someone came to the room each night to put a little bag of sleep crystals on the pillow. It was a nice touch. I ordered room service about 9:55pm one night and while they at first said, 'i don' think we're serving anymore', they said they would be able to bring it... apparently it closes at 10pm, but that's a bit annoying - that's exactly when you want room service. I liked the style of the room and the bathroom was a good size with various places to put your stuff, although not one big area. The shower and towels, robes, etc, were good. Bed was not bad, but definitely not the best hotel bed I've experienced. Toronto hotels are not cheap, but I felt I got a solid deal at this hotel and it was very close to the office.

Reviews.Title: “Good service, somewhat disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: dtmwdc
Reviews.Content: All around good service (front desk, spa, restaurant). Spa very nice and super efficient. Strange disappointments in a few areas. Bed sheets did not fit correctly - tiny fitted sheet would come off mattress in the middle of the night. Linens were average quality. WiFi generally did not work. Very limited room service menu; no hot breakfast . Super small fitness center (I think they converted a hotel room). Location probably very good for business travelers (seemed near banks and insurance companies), but that part of town was dead on the weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel..”
Reviews.Author: daniel1583
Reviews.Content: Room was beautiful, I had a studio but a friend had the one bedroom suite which was much nicer, but my room was perfect for one person if you are happy to not have a seating area, the only gripe was it was $20 a pay for Wifi, and for a hotel like this, it should be free....breakfast was very good, spa lovely but most of all, the staff were superb...definitely stay again

Reviews.Title: “Excellent option!”
Reviews.Author: Polarela
Reviews.Content: Within walking distance from many points of interests, nice restaurants, Saint Lawrence market, Distillery District, etc... Nice stylish and clean room (ours was floor 16, room 01), just one complain: the internet service is not included and the charge was a little bit expensive, but no problem regarding that matter: there is a starbucks on the corner with free internet. The staff at the front desk in the reception always willing to help. Stayed with my wife 4 nights and we wish we could have stayed more, absolutely an option for future visits to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful with your incense!”
Reviews.Author: gina021
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on a quiet side street in a great area of downtown off Yonge. Decor was very modern, zen. Our suite was on 8th floor, # 2. The view was certainly not bad, but we just looked at other office buildings (not the city or lake). I loved the clean wood floors, and no creepy carpeting. The bed was small - probably double, not queen. There was a kitchenette, stackable washer/dryer, balcony. No sitting area. When we arrived in our room at 10pm, there were no towels or toiletries in the bathroom. Housekeeping did not finish our suite. They quickly brought the items after we called the front desk. You are given a choice of incense (nice!) for turn-down at night. Upon entering the room, it smelled wonderful, and the incense was nicely displayed in the kitchenette with a pack of matches. Tip: notice the location of the smoke detectors BEFORE lighting the incense. Let's just say that I did not, and it was a very loud night for all of us on the 8th floor. All in all, it was still a romantic getaway for my hubby and I and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Oasis in the Big City/Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: OffToSeeTheWorld0410
Reviews.Content: The soothing Zen atmosphere of this boutique hotel combined with its warm & accommodating staff, spa & lovely breakfasts made this our home in Toronto. Suite 2602 was spacious & immaculate with an awesome view, divine bedding, two flatscreen TVs, kitchen, washer/dryer. Perfect for our weeklong 20th anniversary getaway. Exquisite spa treatment: hour coupleâ€™s massage plus bath & facials. Eight Wine Bar has a great tapas menu. Great location: walking distance to theatre, dining, conveniences, cafÃ©s, jazz clubs. Melissa, Bianca, Lauren, Lucy, Tak & Raja rolled out the red carpet. Weâ€™ll definitely return! A hidden gem in the Financial District.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome! By far our favorite Toronto destination!”
Reviews.Author: DMBFan77
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying here and it is the best! Service is excellent! Location outstanding! Rooms are unique and out of this world! This is literally our new home away from home! We will always be staying here when we go to Toronto. The view on the upper floors are beautiful. From one angle you see lake Ontario and the other angle you get the Toronto skyline with the CN Tower. -5 minute walk to Eaton Center -2 minute walk to subway systems -valet parking (a bit pricy but at least we don't have to worry about our car) -great staff! All and all the only thing I hate about this place is that I have to leave. -

Reviews.Title: “I would live at this hotel if I could!”
Reviews.Author: trave1gal
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel before, and loved it. This time I brought my 10 year old niece, as we were in town to see a musical and do some shopping. I got a bigger room this time. It had a living room with a couch, which my niece slept on comfortably, and a bedroom for me. It had 2 TVs so we didn't have to watch the same thing.. The view was fabulous! I LOVE this hotel, and can't wait to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service - ruining my guests stay a week before my wedding”
Reviews.Author: sada27
Reviews.Content: I was in contact with the hotel mid-late September of this year to book a block of rooms for my wedding party and myself the weekend of my wedding. The sales representative was very helpful and kind on the phone and appeared to sort out the appropriate booking with room rate. My guests began to call to book their rooms and a week before my wedding they were advised they could not find the wedding block. I was/am devastated. I was really looking forward to spending the weekend with family and friends. It would appear the person who did the booking of the block "is no longer working at the hotel" and she did have all the appropriate paperwork filled out to ensure this would happen without a hitch. Needless to say - the upper management was not responsive to our complaints. They did not honour e-mails that we had in our possession from their sales representative about the block and it being booked for our party. They were not friendly - kind - or apologetic about the incident. Just matter of fact about the fact that they were now booked and could not assist us any further. I am strong believer in good customer service - and I believe because this is a smaller boutique hotel - they do not have the same desire to please as the larger chains. I will not book here again and have such a terrible feeling about my upcoming stay at their hotel. I have not stayed at the hotel yet - and cannot speak to the cleanliness of the rooms or sleep quality, etc.

Reviews.Title: “OK hotel - poor housekeeping”
Reviews.Author: alphasao1
Reviews.Content: This is an OK hotel for the price. Very small rooms and the beds are supposed to be Queen but are really more like Full beds. Not to comfortable when your husband is 6'3". One morning my husband and I left for about 3 hours and when we came back the room wasn't made up yet (no big deal, going out again around 4:30). Housekeeping called our room and asked when we leaving the room since they leave at 5:30 pm (almost kicking us out). We ending up leaving at 3:30 and came back around 6:00 pm. and discovered they barely cleaned up and left the same bathroom glass which was dirty, for 2 days. YUK!!! Management needs to revamp housekeeping!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Room did not live up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: Company_President
Reviews.Content: I had high expectations from the hotel web-site but the rooms did not deliver. The first room I was offered, was small, on the back of the building and I could hear the noise from a large external AC unit outside. The next room had no curtains, only wooden blinds (the type with slats) that did not create a complete black out, so I had trouble sleeping. Also, I didn't enjoy the lack of privacy on the front of the hotel where the local office staff in adjacent buildings could look in. Staff were mixed in their friendliness and customer service. Would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Option”
Reviews.Author: jvaj60
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Film Festival; hotel met all our needs. This is a boutique hotel which to me means limited services and not a convention hotel atmosphere. The hotel was exactly what we expected -- did not experience any of the major service/cleanliness problems from other reviews, although hardwood floors could have been cleaner. Rooms are good size; seating in living area was individual chairs instead of couch. Make sure you request non-smoking room if this is important to you -- the property has smoking rooms, which for a non-smoker can be a problem during high occupancy. Cabs readily available within 1/2 block; metro nearby. Front desk staff cordial, although has limited personal experience at many of the restaurants we asked about.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat that price!”
Reviews.Author: toyBeirut
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at the Cosmopolitan. They gave us a very nice suite located on the 25th...or 26th froor. It was a corner suite with an amazing view (suite 4) on the CN tower. The room was equipped with a kitchen, 2 plasma TV's, AC, washing machine, etc... It is clean and comfy, and we paid 249$/night! What could beat that!

Reviews.Title: “The cure for the common hotel . . .”
Reviews.Author: Relentless_Passion
Reviews.Content: Cosmopolitan Toronto continues to be our favorite boutique hotel destinations. The brand experience consistently retains the 'wow" factor. It is easy enough to be taken in by the hotel's cleanly-executed modern aesthetic . . .mixed with Zen touches. What leaves an even more profound impression is the Cosmopolitan's energetic/attentive/passionate team. Whether it is a restaurant recommendation / reservation, "where to find" dilemma or enhancing creature comforts . . . everything short of reading one's mind. Special kudos to Bianca and Kyle : ) They are the reason why staying there is so effortless, and why we will definitely be back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “super friendly, clean, beautiful interior, great location. Well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: 613613ottawa
Reviews.Content: This place is stunning and at a good price too, i'm glad i chose it. The street that its on is unappealing but it's quiet and convenient. Once i stepped inside i was blown away. Everyone was very kind and courteous. They offered to hold our bags for us after we checked out, so we could go out shop. The location is perfect. Right in the core of downtown Toronto. The staff will get a cab for you as well if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Flies and bugs in our bathroom every morning, very dirty rooms, continental breakfast ended me getting food poisoning”
Reviews.Author: girltravelme
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband booked at this hotel for our honeymoon, and I am not impressed with hotel. I have never stayed here before and was expecting so much more. I ended spending a whole day sick after I ate their terrible eegs and warm yogurt that had not been put on ice or even cold. Very pathetic to see that they treat their customers like that right in front of them. The room are very old looking paint on walls never been retouched, railing in bathroom for towel always falls off when you open door, flies repeatedly were in our bathroom in morning and they were coming from vent, balcony railings and surrounding area had never even been washed and has a 2inch thick of dirt, plus we were over booked on first day and sent to their sister hotel to a terrible smelling room that smelt like smoke and never been used for month.... with all windows closed and the heat marinating the smell even more. I would not recommend hotel unless you love to deal with stress....... And through all of our problems the hotel didn't even give us any compensation and I mean nothing not even a free drink.

Reviews.Title: “Fun hotel in a great city”
Reviews.Author: TravelFan58
Reviews.Content: My recent stay at the Cosmopolitan Hotel exceeded my expectations. I enjoy quirky, boutique hotels and the Cosmopolitan fit the bill. The suites are nicely decorated, very large and well stocked with enough cookware to prepare a meal (although who would want to? Toronto has great restaurants!). There is even a yoga mat should you need one. The staff is friendly, pleasant and eager to please although sometimes seem a little overwhelmed. Breakfast was included with our room and the was an ample buffet but the eggs were cold three days in a row (I'm a slow learner) and overall the quality was just OK. Even though it was Summerlicious and we didn't have reservations, they found room for us at their restaurant, Eight. We had a wonderful meal there at the Summerlicious rate of 35.00 per person. The hotel is easy walking distance to the St. Lawrence Market and the financial district as well as the Eaton Center area. I got a good rate over a weekend but be forewarned that the financial district is relatively dead on Sundays. Overall I would rate this hotel quite highly particularly if you are tired of tiny cookie cutter rooms and are looking for something a little different.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel and staff!”
Reviews.Author: diablopixel
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying in Toronto, we chose the Cosmopolitan because it was the least expensive hotel we could find in the downtown area with my government rate. It was even less expensive than rooms with no kitchen! This was the best decision ever! Very clean, helpful staff, very nice and spacious rooms. Very quiet considering the hotel is located downtown, the only noise that could be heard was sirens once and a while and a constant backnoise of air conditionning outside, but it wasn't enough to bother us. The sound can be easily drowned out by music or the noise of the fountain. I love how the room is decorated! The only problem we had was when we got here the parking spots at the front were all taken, so a staff person told us to park on the other side of the street while we checked in and took our stuff to our room, minutes after parking we got a parking ticket, but when we came back down, someone from the reception area had already cleared it up and we will not need to pay since we are from out of town (Quebec), if we do receive papers about this, the hotel will pay for us, which is very nice considering it wasn't really our fault. Parking in the area is a bit expensive, 20$ on a weekday and 10$ on the weekend (not on-site). The staff offered to help us bring our bags up, they are quick, organised and seem to really enjoy their jobs, which is nice. We took a nap in the afternoon, so the maid stopped by in the evening when we were gone for a walk and made our bed, left some incence in the kitchen and an amethyst stone on the bed with the meaning, there are 7 incence scents to choose from when you check-in and they leave you one of 8 stones. I found this to be a nice personnal touch. The location is perfect, we were able to easily walk to the Eaton Center and to the CN Tower and there are tons of stores and restaurants around (although we did not go to the restaurants because we made use of our small kitchen in the room, there was everything we needed, stove, coffee machine, microwave, mini-bar fridge, dishwasher). The washing machine and dryer are handy if you are here for more than a few days or if you plan on doing some shopping. We are on the 12th floor, not much of a view, but we're not facing any huge buildings, we have a nice balcony and about 4 buildings surrounding a lower rooftop garden that we can look at.

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious Zen in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: KarenKitten
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel many times in the past couple of years and keep coming back - the service is attentive and efficient, the rooms are quiet and beautifully decorated in a modern Zen style. They offer turn-down service, and a daily selection of incense. While the fully equipped kitchenettes and mini washing/drying machines must be very useful for business travelers, we haven't used them yet. Although I appreciate having the option, should we be staying longer. I love the Shizen spa! I've had a massage/facial combo twice now, and always come away feeling very very relaxed. The attached restaurant has good food and service, but the menu doesn't change very often, and I do prefer constant variety. Luckily, there are a wide variety of very very good restaurants within walking distance. I love exploring the area for new choices and taste experiences! My only critique might be that many of the services that a boring run of the mill hotel might offer for free - a fitness room, internet service, parking - all have extra charges at the Cosmopolitan. They are already an expensive hotel in an expensive part of the city - asking for more common amenities just seems..... tacky.

Reviews.Title: “Cleanliness is an issue!”
Reviews.Author: tokyohos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located on side street Colborne St., just off of King and Young, which for us was a handy location. When you walk in the hotel, the front desk is compact as is the bar. We were shown a room with a "balcony", but it was just a sliding door with about six inches of space. You could definitely not go and even stand on the ledge unless you had a suicide wish. The only thing that we found if good for was ripening up avacados (see photo). We decided not to choose this room, but rather a room on the 27 floor that had a view of the CN tower, with a peek at the water behind. No complaints about this. We chose the style of room that is an "open concept". Although it feels very roomy, the curtains allow much light it, so you cannot really sleep in. We did like the lay out of the room and the contemporary feel of it all, however the furniture in the room has seen better days and is worse for wear (see photo). Our biggest issues are the following: extra daily charge for internet, no ice(must ask at front for delivery), CLEANLINESS. Okay, into the the biggest problem, which is the lack of basic cleanliness. Cleanliness problem #1) The sheets on our bed never fit properly and we were staying for six nights, so I requested on the second night that they please change to a seet that fit the bed. The maid said that someone had put the wrong sized sheets on the bed and went to get new sheets. When she stripped the bed, it was noticable that there was NO mattress pad or barrier between the mattress and sheets. When she made the bed, she did not correct this. I had to make a seperate request to get a mattress pad. When it came, it was old and rumpled and the elastics were not even working ot keep it in place. The maid had to make some phone calls to get some sheets that would fit. This took some time and when they arrived, again they were rumpled. But, worse, the top sheet had stains on it and the bottom sheet had holes in it (see photos). The maid could see this as well, but never corrected it. I didn't want to bother her yet again to have to make another phone call and get who knows what linen off of who knows what bed, so I let it ride. A few days later, the same maid asked me if I wanted the sheets changes and I said, "well, we are here for one more night and there are holes in the sheet." She never changed them. Cleanliness problem #2)When we checked in, the back of the purple tub chair had some type of liquid spilled all over it. This was never cleaned off the entire 6 nights that we were there. Cleanliness problem #3) Even though the maid made the appearance of tidying up and mopping, a very poor job was done. When we checked into the hotel, we noticed a pill on the floor in the bathroom. For six nights, that pill remained on the floor (see photo) Cleanliness problem #4) The bathroom tiles in the shower were filthy (see photos). The good: location, room size and lay out, large windows, price. The bad: unhelpful staff at the front (esp. the woman with the British accent), cleanliness, dubious t.v.s. Would recommend, but would state that you must be diligent about getting your room serviced properly.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in the heart of downtown”
Reviews.Author: jenni55
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night at the Cosmopolitan Hotel, and it was an amazing experience. The rooms are incredible and come with a balcony. We were on the 26th floor and our view was beautiful. The rooms are equipped with a kitchen, and laundry facilities which came in handy. No need to go out to eat since the kitchen comes with dishes, pots and pans. The hotel decor gave you the sense to just relax and enjoy. Well worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Fab Downtown Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LondonJetsetter2010
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on our first ever trip to Toronto and it was a pefect home from home. Very Modern contemporary feel to the rooms and we even had our own kitchenette which was perfect for making breakfast and quick snacks before heading out for the day. Metro supermarket round the corner was very handy. The Location is brilliant as you are a walk away from the metro and so close to downtown. We walked into town a few times. Very clean and comfy rooms. Loved it and pefect as a base in Toronto, can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: jullian
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Toronto for a wedding and stayed at the Cosmopolitan because it was close to the wedding and reasonably priced. During prior trips to Toronto we stayed closer to Bloor Street. We were pleasantly surprised with the location. It is just off Yonge street and is close to the Eaton Centre, Queen Street and the St. Lawrence market. We stayed in a smaller suite looking south. The suite was high enough to have a nightly view of the CN Tower which is cool. The suite was the size of a small apartment with a living room/kitchen, bedroom, bathroom and laundry. The service is good, including the Eight winebar in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “do not stay at this awful hotel”
Reviews.Author: quietsleep
Reviews.Content: a terrible hotel - noisy and overpriced. cheap, unhelpful staff. i do not recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing accomodations for a stressful business trip”
Reviews.Author: marisolpsu
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed ad the Cosmpolitan while I was in Toronto for a business trip. The hotel was so relaxing and the staff was helpful and friendly. The rooms were new, clean and full of bright natural light. My room had a kitchenette, which made my trip even more comfortable. There was a little fountain in the room that made the room feel like a spa. I ordered room service several times, the service was speedy and the food was great.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: Rubberduck124
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in March 2009, brilliant hotel, checked in with no problems to room on the 24th floor. It was clean and had everything your could ask for. We had only one issue with the mini bar. We did not realise it was not fully stocked when we arrived and it turned out we had been charged for something we never had. Although the front desk did sort this out for us i don't think they wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded expectations.”
Reviews.Author: keleivis
Reviews.Content: We received an excellent price on a mid-week stay at the Cosmopolitan. The hotel was a pleasant surprise that exceeded expectations. The hotel is an easy walk from Union Station, so the car was left at home to avoid those Toronto parking charges. Our goal for the evening was to take in a concert at Roy Thompson Hall , which is only a 10 minute walk from the Cosmopolitan. The hotel's location is excellent for roaming around Toronto by foot and just steps away from the closest subway station at King and Yonge. After the concert, we were looking for a late night beverage and snack . As their own wine bar was closed for the evening, the staff made an excellent recommendation...the BeerBistro around the corner on King St. This was a comfortable, fun spot to sample an extraordinary selection of draft and bottled beers of the world. Appetizers were also very tasty. Our hotel room was actually a small one-bedroom apartment with kitchen facilities, so it was very roomy by usual hotel standards. Everything was clean, modern and stylish. The furniture and bed were very comfortable. There was no view to be had other than more high-rise buildings, but this was not a priority for us. A buffet continental breakfast was included in the price. Very European style: sliced meat, smoked salmon, cheese, various pastries, breads, cereals, yoghurt... Only one hot item was offered (below-average scrambled eggs), but more than enough tasty alternatives satisfied us. Seating was comfortable and varied. We would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Toronto's hidden gem!”
Reviews.Author: Max0678
Reviews.Content: My partner (now husband) and I stayed at the Cosmopolitan after a trip to NYC. We checked in the night Canada beat the USA at hockey in the Winter Olympics, such a great vibe in the City. After the staff found out we were getting married the next day in Toronto City Hall, we were duly upgraded and provided with treats! 'Bianca' on reception is the sweetest most professional person we have met to date in a hotel, she 'made' our trip! We woke up, got married and loved Toronto and the Cosmopolitan so much, we stayed another night before flying back to New York. Again (now as a married couple) we were upgraded. Complimentary drinks and a late check-out followed. The buffet breakfast is all you need when in a City like Toronto. The hotel experience is like staying in your own top-notch apartment, bags of space! We LOVED every aspect of the hotel, but sadly didn't get the chance to visit the spa, which looked great and we were given discount vouchers too. The Cosmopolitan is definitely the TOP of our hotels to stay in Toronto and will become yours, if you stay there! If you don't, you'll be missing out. Just 'one' niggle, the bar service was 'sometimes' questionable. Other than that, as you've probably guessed! 10/10.

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly surprised by room size, layout and features, front desk incredibly accommodating”
Reviews.Author: Sybilvan
Reviews.Content: Bed so comfy. Great value. Only two things need improvement - internet serice was spotty at best and the continental breakfast poor, need proper breakfast choices. Most pleasant and helpful staff ever encountered. Nice quiet spot, close to subway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Wanderluster2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in late January/early February 2010 for work-related travel and the hotel suited my needs perfectly! I took the Via Rail train from Union Station a few times, which is about a 7-10 minute walk from the hotel; Eaton Centre is also a 7-10 minute walk. I stayed on the 25th floor, which offered a view of the CN Tower. The hotel room itself is spacious and comfortable, with nice furnishings and great floor to ceiling windows. The fountain and the nightly incense were a nice touch. The only thing I didn't like about the room was the lack of storage for clothing. There was only a small coat closet and a narrow closet of shelves available, but a dresser would have fit in nicely beside the bed. I appreciated having a kitchen in the suite, as I was traveling alone and preferred to eat in rather than go out every night and there are plenty of take-out places nearby, as well as a large supermarket (Metro). The only drawbacks for the kitchen were no oven and minimal storage space in the fridge (it's an under the counter fridge and most of the space is taken up by mini-bar items. All in all, I would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “I'll be back”
Reviews.Author: raveman2001
Reviews.Content: This isn't a typical bed in a room hotel. Room was most similar to Indigo-style though staying 3 nights you definitely notice the room details that make it superior. So modern apartment style room, fairly large, wood floors, modern decoration, almost full kitchen. Service was great, very friendly and never delays. Turndown service standard. You definitely notice the smaller size of the hotel as well. Location is pretty much perfect downtown, near the highway too. Not sure about the "hype" over the hotel but its simple, modern and obviously trying to keep a relaxed atmosphere.
