I got a good deal online but then wireless and breakfast were not included, so book based on your needs. I will definitely use again when going to TO on business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, maybe not as good as the hype though...”
Reviews.Author: Greggbb
Reviews.Content: We both enjoyed this hotel, the suite we had was brilliant and was very spacious indeed. The front desk was very helpful, possibly the best front desk service I have come across in all my travels. The location is superb, 5 min walk to the CN tower, 2 min walk to the local tube station, and 5 min to the Lawerence Market. The breakfast was good, and kept us going for many hours. The coffee is nice here too! The bed room was huge, not much of a view unless you like other high-rise blocks. The mini-bar is well stocked and the bathroom is good too. We liked it here, it serviced all of our needs. There is a wine bar downstairs which attracts a good crowd and the lifts are perfectly well kept. I would not think there is a better value hotel in all of Toronto. The spa is not free, and is exceptionally expensive to use for public and guests. It is easy to walk to car rental places from here and it is 5 minutes from the main motorway out of Toronto to Niagara. Every day there is a incense stick in the room with some zen gemstone in a bag thing too. It is a nice touch, even if it means nothing to me. My girlfriend liked it though, I pretended I did so I was in the good books. Thanks Cosmopolitan!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grundlegibson
Reviews.Content: Feels like you are staying in your own modern "zen like" condo. Neat little "boutique" hotel, accomodating and friendly staff, cool rooms (hardwood floors, flat screen TV's, fountain, little kitchen) and overall a great value proposition. When compared to a recent stay at the Fairmont Royal York (which was darn near double the quoted price but apparently the same "4 star rating") this hotel comes out far ahead in my opinion. Although hotel doesn't have the lavish expensive lobbies and common area amenities like the Royal York, I don't really need them nor do I want to pay for them. For my purposes of a quick business or leisure trip in DT Toronto, this hotel was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Eclectic design coupled with practical travel solutions”
Reviews.Author: Jamacat
Reviews.Content: First time staying in Cosmopolitan after staying at other, more established hotels in Toronto and we wouldn't stay anywhere else! The room, on the 9th floor, was a deluxe one-bedroom suite. It had room enough for two of us to feel comfortable (about 470 sq. ft). The bedroom, while a bit small, had a small chest of drawers for clothes. All the beds are Queen size and can be a bit confining, but they ARE comfortable. The living room has a small couch, desk and chair, coffee table and two ottomans. TVs in the living room as well as bedroom. In the sleek bathroom, there is a vessel sink on a slate-topped open cabinet---very nice. There is no bathtub, but the shower was good enough for our stay. It has a full kitchen in a modern design with breakfast bar; we brought our breakfast up from the breakfast room (price included with room) and were able to have leisurely mornings. There is a washer/dryer which is a plus for anyone who has been on the road for a long time. The water feature in the living room is a creative, soothing addition. The nightly incense on the breakfast bar and gemstones placed on the bed symbolizing energy, spirituality, etc. were an interesting touch. The suite was immaculate and the housekeeping serivce was excellent. We did have to ask for extra towels, but that request and other similar ones, were met with a quick response by Housekeeping. The breakfast, included in our room rate, was a pretty good Continental served in the downstairs bar by a very friendly, competent server. Yogurt, fresh fruit, bagels, bread and sweet pastries, as well as coffee and premium tea are available. The front desk service was wonderful; compliments to Bianca for her friendly and knowledgeable demeanor. All our questions/ requests were always met with a smile and a quick solution. She even provided us with poppy pins to commemorate Remembrance Day (Veteran's Day in the US). We had a car pick us up and drop us off at the Toronto Pearson airport; the hotel arranged this for us (courtest of Raja) and the cost ($75 Canadian from the airport and $55 Canadian to the airport) could be paid separately or added to the hotel bill. The hotel is located just three minutes' away from the Hockey Hall of Fame---great location! It is also possible to access the city's extensive PATH system (the underground shopping/eating area used to get through the main part of town in the cold, snowy winter) from quite close to the hotel. Using the King Street entrance (one block from the hotel) I walked underground to the Eaton Centre (the large mall on Yonge Street). There are restaurants, food courts and washrooms all along the way. The hotel is also about four blocks away from the popular St. Lawrence market, which is open every day except Sundays and Mondays; it is a great place to get an inexpensive, but tasty breakfast or lunch or just do some sightseeing. All around a great hotel with lots of extra amenties that we wish all hotels would offer! We didn't utilize the spa or bar but both looked modern and quite popular. One drawback--like most busy cities Toronto is quite noisy and we found that our ninth-floor suite was a bit too close to the street noises for our comfort. We will ask for a higher floor next time. We would definitely recommend a stay here if you are travelling to Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Would definitely recommend ...”
Reviews.Author: sarahnolan29
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the opening weekend of the film festival (honestly, had no idea when I booked this leisurely trip!)... I would definitely say though that this place is exceptional, especially when you compare the room rates to comparable hotels in Toronto. We had hoped for a high floor and we were on the 9th (not too bad in my opinion, but the front desk repeatedly apologized about not being able to book it higher). Upon check in, we received a relaxation CD and chose our incense that they would bring to the room each night (which was inconsistent, but still a nice gesture). The front desk staff and housekeeping were the only ones really really interacted with and they were great for the most part. I did booked a massage in the spa and thought their facilities and staff were quite nice too. This place, like others have mentioned, is a great location... we walked everywhere for four days. One of the days we took the subway to Yorkville and the entrance was right around the corner from the hotel. Its right off King Street and just far enough away from the hustle and bustle. The only con about that is that the parking structure was a few blocks away (which is awkward with luggage!). The rooms are really nice and have full kitchens; a luxury we didn't feel we needed but ended up enjoying the fact that we had it. Personally, I loved the feel of the rooms, but don't be surprised, they are pretty small... think like, New York City studio apartments. I happen to think that's cute, but some people (like my 6'1" 200+ lbs husband) might not agree =) The only real complaint I had was that we had a terrible time sleeping our first night... we checked in after 2am and were exhausted after a long drive, but there was SOMETHING going on below us (in this little nook between all of the buildings- directly below our balcony, check out my pics). We never figured out was it was, but I think it had something to do with the dumpsters... were they dumping garbage, compacting garbage, moving dumpsters, I have no idea, but it was very loud but we were too tired to even call anyone (my guess is that they were getting calls from other guests though). It didn't happen again though after that night.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Tira_20
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right at King Street. It's about a ten minute walk to Eaton Centre and Dundas Square. Restaurants and shops close by. The room was big and clean. Nice bathroom and kitchen. Friendly staff. The breakfast buffet is nothing special - I recommend breakfast at the Senator Restaurant instead (249 Victoria Street). There is a computer with internet access (I think it was on the 4th floor), but it's not free.

Reviews.Title: “Favourite hotel in Toronto.”
Reviews.Author: t.ocouple
Reviews.Content: Most peaceful stay ever! The staff there were great, so accommodating. The rooms are spectacular; itâ€™s all about the feng shui. Beautifully decorates suites, with a yoga mat for your morning workout. When you check in, you can pick your nightly turn down scent (I chose vanilla). Great location, just steps from the Eaton Centre (shopping) and close to nightlife. Small balconies in most rooms, backing onto a quiet lane just off of Yonge Street. The Spa on the 4th floor is beautiful. Canâ€™t wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: jesleb
Reviews.Content: Pretty good hotel. A few 'bumps', such as lamp not properly working, had to get help to get volume on tv, room service came without napkins, and there were not any in the room. Other than that a great stay. Staff was very helpful and very quick, the spa was fabulous, they lent me whatever I needed on my way out the door - matches, umbrella, directions,etc. I'd stay again, but not for full price - If I can get a discount like I did this weekend - 15% for a 2 night stay, then I would.

Reviews.Title: “Just do it!”
Reviews.Author: Gigidoe
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel! Wonderful atmosphere! Friendly, serviceable staff. Great room with relaxing water feature. I mean, I came to work, and I did spend alot of time in my room working, but still I left feeling relaxed. It is about three blocks away from the eaton center but it is quite and calm. I was a woman traveling alone, so a good location and feeling safe is a big issue for me. This was in a great neighborhood. Close to stores for shopping etc. What can I say, just do it! The only points they could improve on were; it is very clean, but not spotless, I missed having a sofa, regarding the WiFi connection: although it was fast and good (I was constantly online) I kept having to log in periodically with my password on the welcome screen. But WiFi was included in the price, although on their site it said I had to pay extra which turned out not to be true in my case. Believe me; it's a small thing. I used the internet heavily and constantly for work and the logging in was a minor annoyance. Their breakfast (also included) could be improved, there was not a lot of choice. I loved it there, and I will certainly return next time I'm in Toronto!

Reviews.Title: “very good”
Reviews.Author: Marakella
Reviews.Content: It was a pleasure to stay in this hotel and to come back to my nice room (deluxe type) after a busy day. Clean, quiet and centrally located.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: blackchiffon
Reviews.Content: Upon booking this hotel, I was worried that this hotel only looked good in pictures. I kept my expectations low, but boy was I pleased! First of all the location was very convenient, just blocks away from the Toronto Eaton Centre and one corner away from the subway station. Our room, a deluxe suite, was exactly as expected, if not better; very stylish, zen, comfortable and well equipped. Housekeeping was really good, but what impressed me even more was the ever so helpful front desk staff. I went down to ask for directions and general questions, and everyone was always very helpful and extremely friendly. I almost didn't want to go home! I will absolutely come back to this hotel if I can!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Staff”
Reviews.Author: El-Ingles
Reviews.Content: We booked through Expedia and, after clarifying that our internet connection was included in the reservation, our interaction with the staff was nothing short of outstanding. The room was well equipped, the housekeeping excellent. Both Bianca and Lucy went out of their way to be helpful and pleasant at all times and would be an asset to any hotel lucky enough to hire them. Location was good and we would recommend this hotel all the way

Reviews.Title: “Best Service we've ever received, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vantravel77
Reviews.Content: We booked the hotel for a short honeymoon stay. My husband called ahead and they upgraded us and allowed a friend to come and decorate the room with roses as a surprise for me. The room was amazing, beautiful furnishings, comfy bed, very...very quiet floors with only 5 rooms per floor. The room was amazing, but the best part was the staff. They were professional, welcoming and especially helpful. We wanted to stay an extra day and Bianca (amazing service!!!) totally helped us out with the rate! Tak at the front desk was also extremely friendly and helpful. Lucy was great upon checkout. The staff were truly amazing and made our experience worth every penny and more! The location was great too, steps from the subway, attractions and on a quiet little street...so great. Close to shopping, Eaton Centre and Queen Street! AMAZING PLACE!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Thirko
Reviews.Content: We booked the Cosmopolitan when we could not get into its sister hotel, Pantages. We booked through Expedia based upon Trip Advisor reviews and also location to a Bikram Yoga Studio nearby (same street it turned out). We were pleasantly surprised by the rooms and the service. We wanted a room self catering facilities altho we did not use them, but as we were on the road and living out of suitcases and our next stop was UK we wanted to do some washing etc. Staff were great. Room was good - nice touches with the incense and turndown service. Breakfast while not great was adequate and we were able to fuel up for the day. Location is great and we were able to walk around to most things in the three days we had there. The staff assisted us with booking our Niagara tour and were really great. Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great apartment-style hotel with all the hotel amenities & service!”
Reviews.Author: FlippinFeet
Reviews.Content: Went to Toronto to attend a wedding. Orbitz offered a great air/hotel deal - better than booking wedding guest rates / airline separately. Some deals w/ free breakfast + internet access. I selected 1-bdrm unit. Had great convenience of in-room washer-dryer; kitchen (sink/ fridge/ burners/ microwave/ dishwasher/ coffemaker); wi-fi internet access; iron/ ironing board Bathroom had large walk-in shower with toiletries; hairdryer

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended. Great location, great experience.”
Reviews.Author: Cooperclt
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed everything about our 4 day stay. I agree with the negative comment about the stocked mini-bar (no room in the fridge), but everything else exceeded expectations. The suite was larger than expected with a separate sitting room/living room/kitchen where we spent most of our time when in the room. The bathroom was off the living area and not the bedroom, which was nice. If you require a king bed, you will feel crowded, but the bed was comfortable with great sheets and pillows. The windows open and we had a balcony overlooking a beautiful terrace behind the hotel. Service was excellent and the town car shuttle to the airport was competitively priced (we paid the same as the cab fair from the airport to the hotel). Definitely a great experience and a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant, modern and well located on the cusp of St. Lawrence Market and Downtown”
Reviews.Author: interpolation
Reviews.Content: Just a few metres off of Yonge Street on quiet Colbourne Street, the Cosmo is easy accessible by TTC and within walking distance from major attractions like the St. Lawrence Market and the Flatiron Building. My room was elegant, modern and well-planned out, with larger floor the ceiling windows, a balcony providing views of Toronto's skyscrapers, Lake Ontario and the St Lawrence Market area and a full kitchen. It was the perfect romantic setting for the birthday celebration I planned for my partner - and all the better, because it wound up a horribly rainy day and we stayed in for most of the night. The bed was probably one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in ... and it was hard getting up to get fresh breads and cheeses for breakfast the next morning at the St Lawrence Market. Highly recommended if you're in need of a little R & R. The only downside, in my opinion, would be the new room service menus implemented in April 09; we had the old ones in our room and when ordering, were told about the new, and upon review they didn't offer as many tasty options. The bar at the base, however, was elegant and hyper-designed, with red hues and a wonderful instalation about the bar. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Zen Room with a Hurly-burly View”
Reviews.Author: SEMichiganWastrel
Reviews.Content: A simply elegant place from which my son and I could sally forth to visit the fine museums and other sites -- a healthy walk or a speedy subway ride away -- and return to for quiet and peaceful comfort, this hotel worked well. Especially fun was our 16th floor walk-out balcony with a view of the CN Tower in one direction and the full moon in the other, although the view a couple of stories farther up would be even more scenic. The staff were very pleasant and accomodating. The workout room is small, but worked well for me, being open 24/7. I only wish that I had scheduled some time for a foot massage in the spa -- definitely next time!

Reviews.Title: “The front desk staff was great but the rest was not impressive”
Reviews.Author: Blessed0610
Reviews.Content: The guest services staff was great and they were very helpful. The incense at night was also a nice touch, however, the rest was not impressive. First off, they should not advertise that they have a refrigerator because it is really the stocked mini bar. Also, when we pulled our sheets back the fitted sheet had a large yellow stain, the pillow cases were stained, and the shower floor was dirty (which ended up being stains from not being properly maintained). We called down to have someone clean the shower and change the sheets. When he changed the sheet I noticed that the mattress pad was stained with similar stains from the sheets which grossed me out. He was just going to leave that as it was and place a new sheet on the bed. It was so disgusting that I asked for that to be changed as well. From then on (we were there 3+ nights) there were stains on the sheets and/or pillow cases every time our sheets were changed, which I DO NOT expect from a 4 star. Oh and there was construction right next to and across the street from the hotel (the other side of the street was dug up) with quite a few tractors, etc stationed there that made for an eye sore and difficulty accessing the hotel. Also don't be fooled by the "every room has a balcony" because all we had was a sliding door that opened up to a space that you couldn't even go out and stand on if you wanted to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it Madly!”
Reviews.Author: Rockinmominar
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Cosmo July 13 - 18. We couldn't have asked for a better hotel. EXCELLENT and FABULOUS front desk staff! They went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. Great suggestions and they treated us like family. Their attention to detail helped make our stay memorable. Spotless rooms, great maid/maintenance staff. Execellent security - need your room key to get on elevator. Wonderful SPA! GREAT location - walking distance to fantastic restaurants and steps away from the subway. Will definitely go back when we visit Toronto again. THANK YOU COSMOPOLITAN for a unforgettable stay and a comfortable place to rest our heads!

Reviews.Title: “Bedroom too small for comfort”
Reviews.Author: louloulemon
Reviews.Content: The bedroom was so small there was no room for suitcase or even a chair to sit (except at the desk situated directly under the television. The only place to sit was on the bed! The room was also quite dark as well as the lobby and breakfast room. The desk and breakfast staff were not exceptionally friendly. One can do much better in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from Home”
Reviews.Author: sakurajan
Reviews.Content: Great room and amenities. Excellent staff and great location....Parking was a bit pricy but this is usually the price you have to pay in downtown. I truly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Cancellation policy is not convenient when travelling on business”
Reviews.Author: Steffie22
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in June and I was on a business trip. I liked everything about this hotel, except their cancellation policy. I was told that I would be changed fees if I canceled my reservation within 24 hours of my reservation. In the business world, things can change quickly and one needs sometimes to change plans and cancel a reservation. While most hotels charge no fees if you cancel before 4pm the night of your reservation, I cannot understand the Cosmopolitan cancellation policy. I would not recommend this hotel to business travelers, but I would recommend it to everyone else.

Reviews.Title: “OK Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a recent one night trip to Toronto. Seemed well-located and reasonably priced. I thought it was a good choice, but not a great one. The positives were the hotel is well situated near the financial district and quite convenient to everything and the front desk staff was very helpful and friendly. I thought the rooms were a bit kitshcy and not the most comfortable I have stayed in. Breakfast bar was ok, not great.

Reviews.Title: “Simple hotel with all amenities, great service and relaxed environment”
Reviews.Author: TulsiLondon
Reviews.Content: This was a great hotel right in the centre of Toronto and walking distance to most attractions. The staff were very friendly and made it easy to enjoy the holiday. We had the deluxe room (mid-range room) which was spacious with a fully equipped kitchenette (hob, coffee maker, sink, utensils, microwave), washer/dryer, iron board etc. They had free Zen mediation classes every evening. I always check into a 5 star hotel but this boutique hotel is great and met my expectations. It may not have the grand lobby or plush decor of 5 star hotels, but the rooms are immaculately clean, simple and have all the amenities that you wouldn't normally get in a 5 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “The Cosmopolitan Hotel R O C K S (pun intended-you'll see)!”
Reviews.Author: Zahava
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a boutique-y type, cosmopolitan, cool hotel just off of Younge Street in downtown Toronto that is not like your average Hilton/Hyatt/cookie cutter hotel, this one is for you! It has everything one could want-attentive staff, clean, rooms filled with Zen and calmness (i.e., when you check in, they ask you what kind of incense you want in your room during the turn down service in the evening ; they leave rocks in little pillows of their own on your pillow to promote certain energies-how cool is that?) , close to downtown, restaurants, pubs and all of major Toronto. Mention you are there for a special day (ours was a big wedding anniversary), and the staff will do all they can to make your stay special. St. Lawrence Market is just down the street (a fun indoor farmer's market ), as are great restaurants such as Mercato (great Italian), Spring Rolls (Oriental everything), and don't forget,"Shuck a Buck" at Big Daddy's on King Street. Our trip to Toronto was all that much more special because of the Cosmopolitan!

Reviews.Title: “zen and hip”
Reviews.Author: familyfun2009_9
Reviews.Content: Must stay here!! My hubby and I decided to leave our darling kids at home this time and have a weekend in the city- A romantic weekend I add. we had previously stayed at Horseshoe Resort and loved it as did our kids. We knew that the Cosmopolitan was also part of Skyline hotels chain so we tried it and really enjoyed. you can really feel a "Zen" energy and sense of calm when you enter the hotel ( hard to believe being located in downtown T.O but true) The rooms are great and very Boutique energy conscious (we liked that) The restaurant in the hotel called EIGHT was very good- Huge wine list and they have a somalier (we just learned about that) to tell you all about the wines and which wines go with which foods etc. We also had a treatment together at the spa, they had rose petals and a jacuzzi for us to enjoy with champagne and treats- we were really impressed. Great massage and spa. Definitely worth going and staying in this hotel and we would love to return one day soon.

Reviews.Title: “Zen experience, even with children in tow.”
Reviews.Author: puilam
Reviews.Content: A visit to a Toronto hotel is usually a scary proposition for us - we never know what the service is going to be like. Cosmo Toronto is everything we want in our hotel experience. It's within walking distance to many Toronto attractions. Service has improved and we are happy to say Toronto is catching up with other international cities when it comes to hotel accomodations and service. The best parts - ultra comfy beds, the full kitchen, washer/dryer (just in case), great lake views from upper floors, roomy living rooms (in the premium suites), and that extra touch of delivered incense. For those who practice meditation and yoga, this is the perfect hotel for you. There was confusion upon check-in whether we could get 2 rooms on the same floor as we were traveling in 2 small families, reservations told us one thing and the check-in desk told us another. We were supposed to have the comp breakfast but, again at check-in, were told it was not included in the room. Check-in cleaned up the mess and we got what was originally requested. This is hotel is not for you if: -you're looking for Ritz-hotel service -you like the grandeur of big lobbies with giant chandeliers -you're not willing to pay the high price for valet parking ($33/night, but there are cheaper off-site options) -you don't want to pay the extra fee for internet connection -you want a pool scene We are coming back. We LOVED ourstay here. Next time we will try the spa.

Reviews.Title: “Like your own apartment _ only cuter”
Reviews.Author: To2uK
Reviews.Content: I used to live in the same neighborhood that the Cosmopolitan is in, and watched as it was turned from what appeared to be a derelict building into the stylish spot that it is now. When I'm back in Toronto, I automatically book into the Cosmo. Part of the reason is the area _ you're within walking distance of great bars and restaurants, transit, and shopping. The other reason is that the rooms are actually more like apartments, with sitting areas and separate bedrooms, small balconies and mini-kitchens. They're very comfortable and stylish, the rooms are extremely clean, bathrooms modern, and the hotel's common areas look good too. I've only been to the restaurant for breakfast, and the room doesn't much do it for me during the day _ it has blood-red walls and can feel a bit oppressive first thing in the morning. Breakfast is served buffet-style, with fresh bagels, yogurt and fruit _ and the coffee is good, so what more could you want? The one downside of the Cosmo is the service. It can be hit or miss. I've dealt with great front-desk folks, who were serious about customer happiness and went the extra mile to chat and make you feel welcome, and service where having to check in a guest felt like more of an irritant. But the style of the hotel, size of the rooms, and decent rates are consistent, and in Toronto, it will continue to be my home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: NYTravelGuru68
Reviews.Content: This boutique hotel is very conveniently located in downtown Toronto. I booked the room through Travelocity for a better rate, then called to specify a smoking room. There are only 5 smoking rooms in this hotel (7th floor only) so make sure there's availability before you book. I believe all smoking rooms are deluxe level rooms. My room wasn't ready when I first checked in (arrived at 11AM) but they stowed my luggage while I went exploring the neighborhood. When I returned at 1:30, my room was ready and my luggage brought upstairs. Having just come from the sister hotel, Pantages, I was a little disappointed when I saw no shop in the lobby, but the advantages far outweigh the disadvantages. The first thing I noticed was the separate bedroom, rather than a studio. Preferable when having guests over for dinner. Unlike Pantages, this room has a mini-bar fridge, rather than full size, so get the mini-bar key when you check in if you think you'll need the extra space. The kitchen is nicely appointed, and there are loads of items for purchase if you so desire. In addition to the fridge, there is a 4 burner stove, microwave, dishwasher, pots/pans, coffee maker, electric tea kettle, toaster and service for 4, including glasses and stemware. Plenty of cabinet space for your groceries. It's just a short cab ride away from the Metro supermarket. The freezer is narrow so keep that in mind when purchasing frozen items. They might not fit. The beds are firm but very comfortable with Egyptian cotton linens. The bedroom has its own television so there's no fighting over the remote. Located under the nightstand, I was pleased to find an air cleaner. Never see those in hotel rooms. The bathroom was smallish and contained a glass enclosed shower stall. I was a little confused why there was a faucet in the shower stall, but it occurred to me that because you need to step in completely to turn the water on, it allows you to correct the temperature so you're not drenched in cold water. A nice little consideration. In the living area, there's a loveseat lounger and desk with chair, complete with CD player and relaxation CDs. Separating that from the kitchen area is a breakfast nook with lovely bamboo plants. Overall, it was a nice simplistic design that had "Zen" written all over it. Very soothing. For added convenience, there is a washer/dryer combo hidden away in the closet. The turndown service is a nice touch as well. A healing stone is left on your bed, along with incense. You choose the scent when you check in. I prefer Ocean. Overall, I was quite pleased with the room and service. Bianca at the front desk was simply wonderful and I hope to see her again at Caribana this summer.

Reviews.Title: “The most romantic and relaxing weekend of my life!”
Reviews.Author: komarra
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Cosmopolitan for our 6 year anniversary. I had booked a superior room with a city view online and made a brief comment that we were celebrating an anniversary and that anything special that they could do to the room would be appreciated. When we arrived 2 hours early we were greeted by an extremely lovely lady named Lucy who had personally read my request. Not only were we checked in early but we received a free upgrade to the best premium suite in the hotel, #4 on the 26th floor. Lucy also informed us that would be able to have a late checkout which we gladly accepted. During our stay we spent some time in the spa and enjoyed a couples massage that was completely tailored to our needs. That evening we ordered room service (which was delicious) and the hotel sent up one more gift. The lovely Lucy had taken the time to write a personal card congratulating us on our anniversary and a box of chocolate dipped strawberries! I almost cried! I have stayed in numerous hotels within Toronto and I am afraid that I have been spoiled and will never be able to enjoy any other hotel again! Thank you Cosmopolitan, thank you Lucy, you made us feel like celebrities and we will be returning very soon! Katie & Erol

Reviews.Title: “Great location, expensive parking”
Reviews.Author: lpoel
Reviews.Content: Great location for our purposes, walking distance to Nathan Philips Square, Theatres, Hockey Hall of Fame and Shopping. The parking was $36/night which is common for overnight in that area, but there should be some discount for being a guest of the hotel. The room was a good size with kitchenette and washer/dryer. Would be great for an extended stay. No city view (looked out onto side street) but there was a balcony which would be nice in summer. We paid $129/night which included breakfast, overall excellent value.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to get back soon!”
Reviews.Author: CLH72278
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Cosmopolitan from February 14-16th for a romantic weekend getaway. Upon arrival, we were checked in a bit early and the front desk staff was very friendly and accomodating. We loved the room, it was beautifully designed though there were obvious signs of wear on the inexpensive furniture. The sitting area was nice but style definitely trumps comfort in the rooms. The bed was a bit firm for my liking. Unfortunately, I came down with a horrible case of the flu on Sunday and spent the rest of the trip sick in bed but the hotel staff were AMAZING - even went out to buy me gravol and brought it up to me. Only issue with service was having to ask for towels on two separate occasions before being brought up (once on Saturday with no response and then again on Sunday) but overall the staff was very friendly and accomodating. Location is perfect for scouting the entertainment district and close to the TTC. We will definitely be back again.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel in the heart of Toronto”
Reviews.Author: Case1096
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 wonderful nights at the Toronto Cosmopolitan Hotel & Spa. From the moment we checked in we were greeted with smiles and a friendly front desk staff. They answered all our question including where to get a late night snack due to our arrival time. We were in room 5 on the 26th floor with a fantastic view of the CN Tower. We were impressed with the room layout including the living room, kitchen, and office/bedroom areas. The bathroom was a typical hotel size bathroom, however it had the funky fixtures of a boutique hotel. The bed was a bit on the firm side, but not as hard as a European hotel bed. The TTC entrance is a half a block away, and with a weekend pass costing $9 CAD per day for two adults it was well worth it. One very minor complaint is the city map the hotel gives at the front desk was not the best. However, on our last day we discovered on the second floor all the attraction and city maps that you normally would find in a hotel lobby. Breakfast was the customary continental breakfast, nothing to write home about but it served our needs to get going in the morning. My wife spent the afternoon at the spa and by the end wanted to take home the Masseuse. Upon check out the staff offered to print our boarding passes and arranged a car service pick up which was the same price as a city cab to the airport. Overall a great value especially since we booked a special on Expedia that cost $102 USD a night. If we were in Toronto again we would surely repeat our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: doctorcranberry
Reviews.Content: We spent a long weekend in this hotel, in their deluxe room. The kitchen with the coffee maker and water boiler is a nice touch, though we were not there long enough to use the kitchen to a great extent, or the washer/dryer, for that matter. The lobby of the hotel is very small, at first i was expecting something more grand, but the location of the hotel itself, and the helpful staff certainly made up for any apprehensions i had at first. We had a great time in Toronto and staying at the Cosmopolitan certainly contributed to our wonderful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience at Cosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: goblue00
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Cosmopolitan for 2 nights for a weekend getaway. Was very impressed with the modern style of the hotel - sleek, simple and unique. There is a kitchen in each room also, which was a nice surprise. The room we stayed in had the bed situated in a corner with floor to ceiling windows on each side of the bed, which was a great feature. Each room also has a balcony which overlooks the city. We also enjoyed a glass of wine from the wine bar on the first floor both nights, overall was an excellent stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hip hotel for a hip city”
Reviews.Author: angel_3691
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan was great! Check-in went smoothly, very polite staff. We used their valet parking service, about $30 per day, but they pull your car right up to the front and it was freezing out so it was worth the price. If the weather would have been nicer there is a parking garage about a block down the street that we would have used. Upon check-in they informed us of their complimentary turn-down service and they let us pick an incense that would be placed in the room upon our return (they did not light it). We stayed on the 22nd floor in room 5, we had a little bit of a view of the city. Our room had a full kitchen (cooking utensils & cutlery included) which if we would have stayed longer would have come in handy to save some money. The bathroom had a nice glass & tile shower (no bathtub) that had a great shower head. They had very nice toiletries. There was also a washer & dryer, which would really come in handy if you plan on staying for a few days. Again the full kitchen really was a nice touch, there is even a dishwasher! There was a good size LCD TV in the sitting area, and another smaller TV around the corner close to the bed. The bed was tucked into it's own little alcove out of view of the kitchen, which was nice. The bed was really comfortable! I didn't want to wake up in the morning! After check-in we went to the lobby to ask about local restaraunts, they gave us a great recommendation for the Richtree. The staff was extremely knowledgeable about local restaraunts, bars & attractions. The Richtree is about a block away, and is not a traditional restaraunt. They give you a card which you "charge" all your food too, there is a ton of little "kiosks" where different food is prepared. There is pizza, asian, mexican, basically a little something for everyone. After eating we went to the Toronto Motorcycle show, which was our reason for staying in Toronto and the reason we chose the Cosmopolitan hotel. It is very close to the Toronto convention centre, about 1 km. For dinner we went to the Irish Embassy, which is about a block away - cheap good food, and a fun bar! Definitely recommended. There is also a few bars up the street from the hotel we did not check them out but they looked promising. We had a few drinks at the hotel restaraunt & bar (Eight wine bar), it was small but pretty hip inside. They also had live music which was a really nice touch, the band was actually quite good! I would definitely recommend the hotel - nice rooms, friendly staff (always remembered our names), close proximity to shopping on Yonge street and close to other Toronto attractions.

Reviews.Title: “City Centre Boutique”
Reviews.Author: KentPaul
Reviews.Content: Have been to Toronto frequently and have normally stayed in the mainstream hotels but thought that it was time for a change. Colborne Street is just off Yonge, close to the Rogers Centre, Air Canada Centre and the CN Tower. It is also just 10 minutes walk to the Eaton Centre so location is perfect. The reception is dark but friendly staff lifted the gloom. Rooms are pretty much the same - mine was on the 6th floor and looked direcly into the office the other side of the (narrow) street. The bed was firm but comfortable but the windows had wooden blinds which didn't reach the edges of the window reveal so light just streamed in. Breakfast is in the bar/restaurant and is a self serve continental. Not a great selection of food or juices but adequate. Overall it was OK but not excellent but I would probably stay there again due to it's proximity to everywhere I need to be.

Reviews.Title: “City Fun!”
Reviews.Author: StilesB
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Big room. Great view of CN tower from our room. Accomodating staff. Close to everything. Be sure to hit the market on Saturday!

Reviews.Title: “The best city hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: ianewestt
Reviews.Content: Why can't every city have a hotel like this one? The location is great - easy to get to by car or public transport and within walking distance of the major downtown attractions. We had a beautiful suite on the 15th floor with a well-equiped kitchen/living room. The hotel's mission to make its guests relaxed - no bad thing in a busy city-centre location - extends to a water feature in the room and a choice of incense sticks at turn-down! The breakfast, which was included in the room rate of less than UKP100, was better than average. Contrary to some reports, we found the staff to be wonderfully friendly and helpful. Some of the city's top restaurants are on the doorstep but the suite was so beautiful that we ate in two evenings - there's a great 24 hour food store 5 minutes away with a liquor store close by. If you've ever wanted to find out what hip city centre appartment life is like, the Cosmopolitan gives you the chance to find out. In London, a place like this would be three times the price. You'd be mad to go anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great small boutique style hotel in central location”
Reviews.Author: phoebe50
Reviews.Content: Boutique type hotel-great location off main street, near transportation, attractions, etc. Helpful staff, nice amenities-asian decor touches, kitchenette. We had a corner room and tho small, 2 walls were windows! Kitchenette was very nice and saved us money and time. Yes, our room was tiny....but who travels to spend time in their room anyway? Also, discounts on spa next door.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: beachgirl3700
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a two day business trip and found the hotel to be quite comfortable and a great value. The size of the room (I was in an 05) was great, and it was quite convenient to have the kitchen and washer dryer in the room. I did initially have a small issue with the a/c which was resolved after I switched it from the "auto" to the "on" position. The hotel was convenient to restaurants and I found the staff to be quite helpful (and pleasant) in making recommendations. Overall, I was happy with my visit and will plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Don't go here if you want to be treated well!!”
Reviews.Author: froggrrl
Reviews.Content: It was eerie to read the other reveiws because they seem to have experienced the same problems I did. Not a coincidence!! I assure you. When I arrived at the hotel, there was no valet or parking. I carried my own bags in to the hotel and to the desk. When I attempted to check in, the clerk informed me that I would need to go to the second floor to take $$ out of an ATM because debit was down. I was charged a fee of $2.00 to take $$ out on top of the $1.50 charge I get from my bank for using an independent ATM. The second room on our reservation had to do this as well. This amounted to $10 in extra fees and they refused to take it off the room rate. Outside of the room, was a terrace where a high school graduation party was held. It was very disruptive and the music and teens could be heard clearly even with the windows closed. The other guests in my party had two men walk into the room while one of them was in the shower with the door open. It was only an hour after check in and they did not knock. Two females were staying in that room and they were very disturbed. When my partner opened the blinds to the balcony, the metal header fell down and narrowly missed her head. It did strike her foot, gave her a good scare and take a chuck out of the floor. Looking at the mark it made I was thankful it missed her head!. When I let the manger know at check out she was rude and I found it to be of little consolation considering everything we had been through in our short stay. I left feeling as if my experience was anything but the relaxing Zen experience the website promised. I piity anyone who has paid full price for this subpar hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Skip the spa”
Reviews.Author: luckyme30
Reviews.Content: I was excited before we arrived but it was a disappointing stay. Although I loved the suite, (we did use the kitchen) the blinds did not open (and were not repaired), the airconditioning was not working throughout the hotel (it was very hot, about 30C) for the entire 4 day stay. The spa is definitely not 5 star. We had pedicures and it took three trips to the spa to book the appointments. The spa staff had no people skills/training. I found the shag rugs cute but a little disturbing in a hotel, how could you possibly clean them between guests?

Reviews.Title: “Great locaion”
Reviews.Author: Benchimus
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a week. Our room overlooked the street, we had a direct view into the office block opposite - thank goodness for the blinds! The room was more like a small apartment - kitchenette, washing machine and tumble dryer were welcome facilities. The whole 'Feng Shui' philosophy about the room design was a nice touch, but I don't know that I was entirely convinced (the complimentary toiletries were charged with a gemstone, and there was a different gemstone placed on the bed each day). The location of the hotel was excellent - we were within walking distance of several major attractions (the Hockey Hall of Fame, Union Station, St Lawrence Market, Rogers Stadium and CN Tower. I would recommend St Lawrence Market as somewhere to visit, we found some good places to eat around this area.) The foyer to the hotel is small, with the entrance to the bar/eatery facing the street entrance. We didn't try the bar, but it looked lively on the weekend. I would recommend as a hotel for business users and those looking for somewhere a little off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience. Delightful gem.”
Reviews.Author: RochesterNYguy
Reviews.Content: After researching Toronto hotels, I came upon this one; loved the reviews. After researching rates with the online websites, I called the hotel directly and negotiated a $179 a night rate for a suite--nice! The best I could find online was $184 for just a room. The location is superb...convenient to the Harborfront, but far enough from the gritty end of Yonge Street--an easy walk to King Street E. and W. Colbourne also has some nice restaurants on the street within a couple hundred feet. Overall, I can't say enough nice things about the place but several things stand out. The room was beautiful--sleek, contemporary and comfortable. The staff was delightful and sincerely nice. Even when the service was quirky in the restaurant or the bar, the folks were so genuinely solicitous you couldn't help but smile. Make sure to ask that they include the continental breakfast, which was very good and more than enough to hold you. One added bonus: Upon checking in, the desk staff offered a 50% off discount coupon for the upscale restaurant in the hotel, which we accepted. We had a fine meal for a reasonable (by Toronto standards) price. Note to travelers who've not been to Toronto in a while...prices on lodging, food and drink have gone up, up and up. There's even a liquor tax now and no more tax refunds at the border. Tip: Park in the underground parking garage at the end of Colbourne Lane and Church Street. You can't miss it. Our bill for parking from 6:00 PM on Friday to 10:00 AM on Sunday was $16.00 total--what a deal! Given the weather and the prices of the surface lots, I am really glad we parked here.

Reviews.Title: “15 thumbs up to the Cosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: NYC-Canuck
Reviews.Content: I booked our staff conference here for April 2008 for 1 week - 15 different rooms for staff from around the world. Personally I stayed on the 25th Floor Room #2. Everybody was really happy with their rooms. As a group we travel a lot and have been in a lot of hotels. Everyone agreed it was more relaxing to come here at the end of the day than a typical hotel as the room set up is better and you don't feel like you're in a hotel - more like you're crashing at your friends place. This is more of a botique hotel. Most rooms are like studio apartments (they also have some suites / larger rooms). They have a small kitchen area - stove top, microwave, dishwasher, small fridge, cutlery, pots / pans, coffee maker, toaster etc. Living room area has a desk, flatscreen tv, two chairs, kitchen countertop with two bar stools. Floors throughout the room are laminate wood floors with a couple of throw rugs. Decor: Modern and contemporary. The furniture looks like it comes from West Elm - if you like that style you'll like the decor. Storage: large closet with good storage space in the hallway. There is an in suite washer / dryer in every room. Plus iron and ironing board. Bathroom: Walk in shower, floor to ceiling tiles, bowl sink, standard toiletries. Two bathrobes in room Bedroom: I had a separate bedroom with a door - small but fine. Had an additional smaller flatscreen tv in there. Bed was comfortable, 4 pillows, bolster, duvet - no bedspread or coverlet which I personally prefer for sanitary reasons. Balcony: some rooms have balconies - mine did but I would not say it was a space you would want to hang out in. No furniture out there and no real view since the hotel is in the heart of the city and surrounded by towers. More likely you would want to open the door to get fresh air (screen door) or step out to have a cigarette (a lot of the rooms are non smoking). Atmosphere: the hotel tries hard to make it a relaxing place for their clients. Thre is a water fountain in the living room, bamboo shoots for decoration, meditation (stretching mat), plus they will have the incense of your choice given to you during turn down service every night. Spa: They have a fabulous spa here in the hotel. Some of my colleagues used it and enjoyed it very much. A swedish massage is $110Cdn for an hour. I believe that hotel guests get a 15% discount. Gym: They have a tiny gym here. 1 treadmill, 1 eliptical, 1 bicycle, 1 bench with free weights, stretch mats, and 1 combined weight machine. Staff: 10 star staff. Everyone is very helpful and friendly. All of our issues were dealt with promptly. We were greeted whenever we came back in to the hotel. Housekeeping: The rooms were clean. If you put your Do Not Disturb sign on the door they will respect it and not come in. Security: Very good. To access your floor you must put your card in the elevator to push your button. Peep hole in door, dead bolt, swing door guard plus digital safe where you program your own code that is big enough to fit a laptop. Downtown is a bit deserted at night. Main streets are fine. Internet: Pay for internet $12Cdn per day. Wireless available in rooms. Had no problems VPN in to work. Breakfast: available on the ground floor. I did not eat there but my colleagues did. This was their one complaint with the hotel. Cost was $12Cdn per day. There was no hot food (omlettes etc), Just toast, bread, and waffles. They used to have the hot food but guess they changed their menu. Nearby: There is a 24 hour Dominion Supermarket a couple of blocks from the hotel. Very large including vegan / vegetaritan foods, organic foods and all the other standard fare. There is also a 24 hr drug store - Shoppers Drug Mart one block away on King St. ATM - there is an ATM on the second floor of the hotel. Also several along Kings St / Main Streets of the city. Getting Here: To / From Toronto Pearson Airport it is a flat rate of $46 Cdn for the taxi + tip (no tolls). Average time is 45 min. There is also an Airport Express shuttle bus that operates every 20 to 30 min. Approx $20 one way or $30 rtn. They drop off to 10 different downtown locations. Airport: Note you go through customs in Toronto if you are coming / going to the USA so allow time in your schedule. When leaving Toronto the customs line can be quite long so don't show up at the last minute - you'll miss your flight. Things to do: the CN Tower for the view on a nice day is great. We had dinner in their revolving restaurant. It's a bit pricey. Food was not fabulous but decent, considering it is a tourist atraction. Service was horrible. Very slow. Think they are understaffed. You can organize tours through the hotel - including to Niagra Falls and in season to the wine area (some tours do both as they are in the same area). 75 miles away - 1.5 hrs drive. Shopping. Tons of shopping in the area. Toronto, known for its cold winters, has a lot of underground malls and people use these walkways to get between building downtown without having to go outside. All price ranges for shopping. Overall we were all very happy with our stay here at this price point (approx $225Cdn / night) and would be happy to return.

Reviews.Title: “Contemporary, European style”
Reviews.Author: gtomaro
Reviews.Content: Toronto: Cosmopolitan Hotel: "Cool Contemporary and European feeling!" Date: August 6, 2006 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member, Pittsburgh PA I booked a room at the Cosmopolitan hotel because I found a great rate on their website. The experience was very rewarding. The hotel feels much like a European hotel in every way. From how it's nondescript exterior and location on a small side street, to the small but very charming spaces. The lobby is small with a very friendly front desk staff. The rooms have a great vibe. First of all they are a full suite with seperate kitchen, hallway, bathroom and bedroom. Most rooms have balconies, but the hotel is crammed in between other buildings so you really don't have a view...and be careful about keeping the blinds open as there could be privacy problems. The amenities are very modern and interesting, from the plants, music and waterfall sounds, to the unique shape and materials of the bedding...all designed to give you new age positive energy. The lobby bar and restaurant is also very contemporary and cool. The food and drink were exceptional...no breakfast but Tim Hortons is just a couple doors away. The location is not the greatest if you want to be by the good shopping and restaurants, but if you're wiling to cab it it is definitely worth checking out this fun hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: sacul
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmopolitan on March 29th for one evening and found it to be a great place to stay. The rooms are modern and well appointed. The kitchen would be helpful to someone who was on a long stay. It is well located about two blocks from the Sony Centre (Hummingbird Centre) and about a ten-fifteen minute walk from the Eaton Centre. One of the highlights for us was the continental breakfast buffet. In keeping with the Hotel, it was designed around the theme of healthy living. It contained an abundance of healthy choices including premium juice, fruit salad, assorted cheeses, Yogurt, fresh breads, rolls, waffles and even real maple syrup. All in all this is a great place to stay and we would be pleased to return anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Very Peacful and Tranquil”
Reviews.Author: Kitcheneral
Reviews.Content: Great hotel. Floor to ceiling windows. Flat screen t.v. Lovely bed modern design. Very tranquil. One problem no parking, but plenty nearby. You are one block of the main street, Yonge St, and walking distance to all the major atractions. Try the pub on the corner the Irish Embassy.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem”
Reviews.Author: FlopsyBunny
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Toronto. Having been to Toronto a number of times I had never heard of the place until I 'Googled' Spa Hotels and up it popped. Excellent. The hotel is a suite hotel and I had a fully fitted kitchen and washer/dryer which was dead handy (well I didn't use the kitchen!). It's in a very convenient location and would definitely stay there again. The spa is called Shizen Spa and that is worth a visit too.

Reviews.Title: “Feel the Zen”
Reviews.Author: mrdeef
Reviews.Content: WOW!!! This place is pretty cool. Very different from any hotel I have ever stayed in. Fantastic location that is walking distance to just about everything. All rooms are suites with a kitchen and laundry room. The staff was extremely friendly and went out of their way to make the stay great. When you enter the room, they have some meditation type music already playing and a fountain in the room. Every night they bring you a selection of incense to increase the whole zen feel. There was a air purifier in the bedroom. All the floors are hardwood with shag area rugs. I have read comments about the blue pleather furniture. This is true, not comfortable stuff, but we did'nt really care. Also, we did not find the bed to be very comfortable, but I suppose they rarely are in a hotel. The wine bar downstairs is very expensive but a lot of fun if you like to sample different high end wines that you would be scared to buy a whole bottle of. All things considered, the Cosmopolitan was a fun stay and I would definitely stay there again on our next trip to Toronto. Lucy at the front desk was friendly and accomodating almost to the point where I felt guilty. I could not find a phone book in the room and needed a map of the Air Canada Center to see where our hockey tickets are. I called the front desk to ask if there was a phone book in the room and they said that there was, but if I could not find it they would bring me a map. I could not find the book and chose not to call and bother the desk. About 5 minutes later, Lucy at the desk called me back and asked if I had found the phone book. When I told her that I had not, she personally brought me up a map. This was just one of the little things that made our experience special. By the way, I found the phone book about an hour later. Oops. All in all, if you want a very unique hotel experience, the Cosmopolitan is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “WOW, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: currencyniagara
Reviews.Content: We had heard about the hotel from business associates and where immediately drawn to the calming and contemporary feel of the hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by professional & courteous staff and immediately knew that we had made the right decision to spend our getaway weekend. Every detail of the hotel was impeccable from the lobby decor, sparse but zen like ti the privacy of your key card that you have to swipe in the elevator to get to your room, great security feature, as well as the care and delicate touches thay made the guest rooms truly on of a kind. The room was so comforatable and enjoyable, it was actually hard for us to leave and venture outside the hotel. The front desk was more than accommodating at every turn, they were very attentive, prompt and made every aspect of our stay enjoyable.Lucy at the front desk made our stay that much more enjoyable with her outstanding customer service and her ginuie kindness. I would recommend this hotel to everyone, as we travel alot this has been been the best hotel experience to date and I lok forward to my next trip to Toronto at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. I heard when I got back that they also own the Pantages Hotel about 5 blocks away.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great”
Reviews.Author: roadrunner191
Reviews.Content: Stayed in February for 3 nights - other choices in Toronto are way better. If you need a suite with cooking and laundry facilities, and need to be downtown, then this place might be an option. Otherwise, you may want to stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Globeam
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmo for one night in late February. Check in was easy and friendly. The location is actually very convenient to St. Lawrence market and the Eaton Centre. It is also close to Union station, the ACC and lots of restaurants. The subway is only one block away. We like the area, but it is quiet at night. We were happy with our room. It had floor to ceiling windows that wrapped around the room. There wasn't much of a view, but there was lots of light. The bedroom itself was small but functional and comfortable. We were on the corner and had a small wrap-around balcony. The kitchen was great. It had a nice sitting area with two stools and a fully-equipped kitchen. There was a full stove, microwave, dishwasher (and they leave you soap) and lots of pots, pans, plates and glasses. Breakfast in the morning is included. Nothing spectacular, but definitely nothing to complain about. They had waffles, toast, eggs, fruit, croissants, yogurt, coffee, tea and juice. They advertise it as continental and it was one of the better continental breakfasts that we have had. We would definitely recommend this hotel to people coming to Toronto, especially those coming for a few days and looking for a comfortable place with a great kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “Did not feel safe Do not trust front desk staff”
Reviews.Author: lilmiss2008
Reviews.Content: I checked in on New Years Eve 2007 around 7pm and the check in staff was really rude, and I used my credit card to check in. I got to my room to find a room that I did not book that was very differently described but for the rate I got I didnâ€™t want to complain. In the middle of the night I get a call from my credit card company asking if I was using the card to pay other bills online and I had said no and to still find the card in my purse it seemed strange. It seems like a staff member or someone who has access to those numbers used it because it sure was not me. Horrible experience! Do not trust the staff!!

Reviews.Title: “No ordinary hotel!”
Reviews.Author: trave1gal
Reviews.Content: I usually stay in a boring hotel when I go to Toronto, but I had read a little about this hotel, and it sounded amazing, so i booked it for my most recent trip. It is incredibly cool feeling! The room was gorgeous, when I first opened the door, I actually said "Wow"! I got a great deal, had a great room, and can't wait to stay there again. I couldn't ask for anything more!

Reviews.Title: “Good value, disappointing facilities”
Reviews.Author: Review_Monkeys
Reviews.Content: Excellent value and good location - our walk to the station was just minutes. The gym was pretty badly equipped and spa was disappointing. However, breakfast was good. Staff was surprisingly unfriendly compared to our experience in the rest of Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!...No complaints”
Reviews.Author: ffdd
Reviews.Content: WOW!... My wife loved it! I didn't tell her where we were going and boy was she impressed. Great romantic getaway if you're looking to plan a nice weekend. Very unique and comfortable. Overall probably one of the nicest rooms and by far the best bed I have ever slept on! They let you choose what aroma of insence you would like for turn down service and they leave a nice stone/quartz on your pillow which was a really nice touch. Music is softly playing for you when you enter the room...guys, do yourself a favour and book this for you and your lady, she'll love it ;)

Reviews.Title: “Pretty Good”
Reviews.Author: lcastanon
Reviews.Content: Spent the weekend in Toronto, and stayed at the Cosmo. Overall pretty uneventful stay. The room was a pretty good size for the money. I got it via a package through expedia and by phoning them was able to bargain up to the largest room available. PROS: Having glassware (real wine glasses) and other kitchen utilities was nice. The whole mood stone thing and insensce that they let you pick from was kind of silly in my opinion. But I guess they wanted to add their own touch to it. It wasnt all that busy when i stayed there. In fact it felt like I was the only guest there. I've been to crowded hotels so that was a nice atmosphere, to have 2 - 3 staff ready to help you. Tastefully furnished. The bathroom was well designed. The walkin shower actually has a door so that you dont drip all over the floor. Something I've never seen in any other hotels ive been to. They didnt make any fuss when i brought an onterage of people to come up. Usually hotels are fussy about 'hotel parties' but i had no issues. I had a great time and one of the days i had people sleep on 'the blue couch' CONS: I do wish that they did provide more seating... for as large as the room is that you pay for they should really accomidate the fact that you can entertain there. I had friends over and there is really only the couch and two bar stools and an ottoman. There is definately room for atleast 2 normal chairs. The internet service was kind of annoying, you have to call in everyday that you want the internet on for them to connect you. I was not so much annoyed that i had to pay a daily fee but that they could have just set up my account so that i can just pay for the days im staying and have it always be on. In other matters, one of the days i noticed that one of the trashcans hadnt been emptied so i mentioned it while i was going out about town, it was taken care of by the time i got back. In all fairness it was a trash hidden inside one of the kitchen cabinets its possible that it was simply overlooked. No biggie. OVERALL pretty good hotel, the location is central but not on the busy Yonge and the staff was pretty accomidating. Wish they would add more seating areas for the size of the room they give tho.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: spencerusa
Reviews.Content: Very good value downtown suite hotel in minimalist zen style. I reseved a two room suite for $229 plus tax per night. There were only two drawbacks to the accommodation. The sofa in the living room was merely a rather hard bench, making watching the baseball playoffs on TV rather less relaxing than should have been the case. More important, the restaurant was shut down during my stay. A parsimonious continental breakfast was on offer each day on a bar counter backed by a wall of liquor, none of which could be served because the former restaurant operator had left with the liquor license. All pretty inconvenient and frustrating. So check that the restaurant has reopened before you book in.

Reviews.Title: “Great modern hotel, OK location and very good value”
Reviews.Author: Payam81
Reviews.Content: This is a very modern hotel with a lot of modern amenities in the suites. These suites are infact the size of small one bedroom condo apartments and come complete with ensuite washer and dryer and a fully equipped kitchenette. Serivce falls a little short of the rest though and needs some overall improvement. Also, don't expect much of a view, you are most likely facing an office building anyways and will probably have your drapes closed unless you're in to the voyeur thing. I highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Unique”
Reviews.Author: bmw330girl
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Cosmopolitan for a weekend. We unfortunately were in Toronto for the High Holidays so we did not have an opportunity to use the spa or gym. We were greetly very professionally and called by name through out the check in process. Check in was very prompt and the car was also taken care of quickly ($30.00 per night +tax to park). It was very nice that at turn down service they give you a pre-selected scent for you room and a small gem stone on your pillow. The room we stayed in was on the 26th floor and had a great view of the Lake and downtown Toronto. The room had a full kitchen and even a washer and dryer and an oversized arrangement with a fountain....very cool!! The beds were comfortable and the only concern i had was that I asked for the shower floor be rewashed upon our check in....this was down quickly and the valet even followed up to ensure that everything was corrected. I love this hotel and it is one of my favourites now.....it reminded me of some boutique hotels in Playa del Carmen the only thing missing was the sand....My husband ( who is in the hotel business) and I will definately go back to the Cosmopolitan in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean and a delight to stay in”
Reviews.Author: PintOfGuinness
Reviews.Content: We stayed in 3 other hotels over our 2 week honeymoon, this was by far the best, the deluxe apartment was so relaxing we tended to spend too much time there. Moder applicances, washing machine dryer, balcony, great location, 2 flat screen televisions, comfortable bed, modern bathroom, microwave, fridge and very spacious. I suppose the only thing was the curtains in the bedroom seeped a bit of light but it didnt disrupt me or my wifes sleep. If I went to toronto again I would book this place for the entire stay. Much better than the old fashioned but similar priced Cambridge suites up the road even though it has a higher trip advisor rating.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic situation and great value”
Reviews.Author: HAPPYPERTH
Reviews.Content: Had never been to Toronto before and we could not have picked a more convenient place to stay. When we booked with the hotel we got a really good deal. They asked if we would be bringing a car and when we said "No" - they told us we could manage without a car as the hotel was very convenient for the sub-way. We actually didn't use the subway as we found we could walk everywhere - CN Tower, Eaton Centre, Waterfront etc. We found the room - actually almost a small apartment - very comfortable and although we did not have a view we loved it. The staff were helpful, the continental breakfast more than sufficient. We have come home and told all our friends that we know the hotel they should go to in Toronto. My brother who lives in Canada and occasionally stays in the King Edward Hotel was very impressed and was amazed at the deal we got

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for business travel”
Reviews.Author: casemnor
Reviews.Content: I booked a week's stay at the cosmopolitan after scoring a great deal on a one bedroom suite. The hotel is in in ideal situation, right on a subway stop (yonge line), and easy walking to great entertainment/eating options (beer bistro is literally around the corner). After reading reviews here I had a bit of trepidation, but it was completely unfounded. My suite had an great balcony, all the amenities, and everything a business traveler could want (except for the extra charge for internet access, which was ok as it discouraged me from working after hours.) I loved the look and feel of the place, down to the crystal on my pillow every night. It is a small, exclusive feeling place...perfect for those of us that aren't seeking a "resort" experience, but rather a home away from home. The staff is quietly unobtrusive, but incrediby helpful/efficient when called on. Sure there is street noise, but come on people...you are downtown. The combination of the sound of the A/C (rattling on the first night was quickly amended by myself by fiddling with the vent), and the air filter provided in the room. I highly recommend this for business travellers seeking a low key, comfortable, high amenity location. I will be back and will be recommending it in house as a preferred location.

Reviews.Title: “three strikes”
Reviews.Author: notsohappy12
Reviews.Content: Had stayed at this hotel before twice and not experienced these problems. 1) A cleaning person walked straight into the room without knocking just 1/2 hr. after we had gotten there. When I mentioned this to the front desk they weren't too apologetic. I think voucher for breakfast would have been nice. 2) We asked for some ice, as there are no ice machines in the hotel We were having a birthday celebration with some friends. It took 1 1/2 hrs. for the ice to arrive after two phone calls. 3) I reserved a smoking room. When we arrived she told me there were no smoking rooms left. What? Isn't that why you "reserve" one in the first place? Anyway, I don't think I'll stay there again. There are nicer hotels in T.O. anyway for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Hotel”
Reviews.Author: macgyver_101
Reviews.Content: Exceptional Hotel. Great staff. Everytime we needed help or information, they would go above and beyond for us. Made our vacation worth every moment. Thank you for the stress-free and great vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place!”
Reviews.Author: BrittKT
Reviews.Content: I was beyond pleased with the Cosmopolitan Hotel & Spa. Upon arrival, I was upgraded to a Studio Suite & had complimentary water & fruit. The staff was incredibly sweet and answered and & all questions I had. The closet was small, yes, however, I did enjoy the extra closet with shelving. The weekend I was there, the hotel offered a discount at the spa, so that was a good treat. I loved the contemporary set up of the hotel. Was very sleek and polished, but I felt like I was at home in my room. The room service was wonderful; pricey, but the entrees were so big I had plenty left over for the next day & was able to heat it up for lunch. Excellent location to the subway & sites [the Eaton Centre is right there.] There are several Tim Hortons [Canada's version of Dunkin Donuts] which was very cheap & excellent. I also went to the market around the courner [and across the st from TIm Hortons] and stocked up on water & a few other essentials. The prices were very cheap there. I traveled alone & was pleased to have the keys in the elevator. Made me feel very safe. This was an incredibly relaxing hotel; I've stayed at the Westin as well, it was lovely there, but there is something about this Boutique hotel that would make me pick it over a large restort. Also, the airport shuttle is about a 2 minute walk [at the Fairmont.] I loved this place!

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: BachJan
Reviews.Content: if you are looking for something different this is the place to stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: Steffibeans
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel this past weekend and had an amazing stay. Our suite was absolutely spotless, and had all of the ameneties we could have wanted, and then some! Our suite came equipped with a washer and dryer (very useful when we got stuck in Sunday's thunderstorm!), fridge, stove, dishwasher, microwave, coffee pot, kettle and toaster, and was fully stocked with plates, bowls, cutlery, glasses (wine and juice), utensils, pots and pans, placemats, diswasher detergent, dish soap, laundry detergent, dryer sheets and even tupperware. We also had two TVs, air purifier, CD Player (with CDs), clock radio and two phones. The complimentary breakfast that was included in our rate was wonderful, with juice, coffee, tea, a selection of fresh bread, pastries, muffins, yoghurt, cheeses, pancakes and cereals. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful - we had absolutely no complaints with our stay and wouldn't hesitate to stay at the Cosmopolitan again, and to recommend it to our family and friends!

Reviews.Title: “A Memorable Experience”
Reviews.Author: GoingEverywhere
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan is a wonderful hotel. Not just nice, but a unique experience in the heart of the city. The hotel was one of the highlights of our visit to Toronto. BASICS: The Cosmo is a 27-floor hotel, with 5 rooms on each floor. The room prices rise as you go to a higher floor. We reserved a room in the middle price range, but the hotel upgraded us to the 26th floor. We could see the lake and had a great view of the CN Tower outside our windows. The building is somewhat hemmed in by others, so the upper floors really offer an advantage when it comes to the view. ROOMS: The room itself offers a truly comfortable queen bed, a separate living area (but inexplicably, only one chair), a full kitchen, and a 7-ft. high fountain! We had two flat screen TVs -- a full-size TV and a smaller one in the bedroom area. The only negative is a shortage of closet space, but you can use the washer/dryer in the room and simply bring less with you. It's a trade-off, I guess, because you'd get more closet space if they didn't have a washer and dryer. The kitchen has all the utensils, wine glasses, dishwasher, stove.... SPA: We had a couples massage and cannot say enough about it. The atmosphere in Shizen Spa is relaxing, the staff friendly and professional. The private treatment rooms are gorgeous and go quite well with the hotel's zen-inspired themes. DOKU 15 RESTAURANT: We had some excellent sushi and a couple a pricey (but tasty) martinis in this ground floor restaurant and lounge. Apparently, the restaurant is separate... we could not bill the meal to our room. But the restaurant also took care of us at breakfast, with a U2 soundtrack during our meal. The breakfast menu is self-service with excellent coffee, bagels, pastries, pancakes, and a small assortment of cheeses. STAFF/SERVICE: Excellent! I ordered a special package one evening, and it was perfect down to the last detail. I left the wine in the car, and they brought it up within five minutes. The staff is prompt, courteous, and efficient. Turndown happens between 6pm and 7pm...in lieu of chocolate :-(, they leave a stone on the bed. It's very zen, apparently. We also got a CD titled "Peace Beyond Stress" -- you get the idea. LOCATION: The hotel is one block from the Yonge Street subway line. It's only a few minutes walk up the street to Eaton Centre. Parking is a challenge; the hotel offers valet at $29.

Reviews.Title: “Uplighting and Lucky Bamboo Do Not a Boutique Make”
Reviews.Author: SundayBest
Reviews.Content: Serenity, boutique, sanctuary, and haven come at a price. Gem tone up-lighting and lucky bamboo do not make for an extraordinary hotel experience, it's not a bad place to stay, simply an average stay at best. Strip away the spa gimmick of the Cosmopolitan Hotel and you have an adequate modern hotel with adequate rooms and average service. Location is your big win here, centrally located in the financial district and right around the corner from Union Station with access to all that Toronto has to offer. Capable front desk staff, tend to be on the cool side and less than eager. Rooms are small and very tight with floor to ceiling windows covered with problematic blinds. One strong yank and the metal valance came flying down. If you sleep late and want to black out your room, you cannot, this is not the place for you. If you have allergies you might want to make other arrangements. Incense and heavy scent abound from the lobby, hallways, rooms and in the hotel toiletries. Down comforter even in the middle of summer and down pillows on every bed. Bathroom lighting is dim if not dark, and you get very warm water instead of hot, making a steamy hot shower impossible. If you are unlucky enough to have a room towards the back of the hotel be warned that construction is being done on a nearby building and adjacent street, noise echoes and travels up the small back corridor, even beyond a regular urban hum. Average modern hotel that masquerades as urban oasis.

Reviews.Title: “Transending Expectation”
Reviews.Author: StarbucksBc
Reviews.Content: It's not often a hotel not only exceeds, but transcends expectations. In an otherwise turbulent trip, this was an oasis. Calm and focused not to mention, simple comfortable elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: ContractOp
Reviews.Content: The Cosmopolitan has a lot going for it--good location in the city, swanky bar and decor and a chi-chi spa (which I didn't try out).
