I was in a studio suite, which was basically an apartment. Full kitchen, washer/dryer, separate bed alcove. Everything is tastefully decorated and there are some nice touches (in-room fountain/light thing, complimentary meditation CD, etc.) I didn't interact much with the staff, but they seemed to be very competent. The restaurant/bar (Doku 15) is a separate entity so you can't do room charges, but it was a great place to hang out pretty much every night I was there. Great bar staff (especially Jeff and Rachael), interesting house cocktails and good music. It's definitely a "scene", so don't stumble down there from your room in your pj's hoping for a quiet nightcap. The only things I weren't crazy about were the very small fitness room and the lack of complimentary wi-fi (also the signal was very weak at the desk in my suite). Otherwise, I'd say it's a great place to stay and one that I'd definitely return to if I'm in Toronto again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Easter Weekend Stay”
Reviews.Author: onecdn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Toronto for two nights on the Easter weekend. After searching extensively and reading reviews, I came across an Easter Weekend family package at the Cosmopolitan. I emailed the hotel using a link from their site to inquire about the package, adding another night's stay at the CAA rate, and whether their suites would accommodate a family of four (occupancy was listed as 2 people on their website). In the email response the person offered us a premium lake view suite for both nights - first night at a discount rate below the posted CAA rate, the second night for the advertised package rate. I did not receive a response to my reply, so after a couple of phone calls - never did manage to speak with the person who emailed me (and at one point ended up speaking with their sister hotel Pantages) - I finally managed to book our stay in a Premium Lake View Suite. For our purposes, the hotel has a great location - within a short walk of BCE Place, Hockey Hall of Fame, St. Lawrence Market and the theatres, shops and restaurants along Front St. - and it is very easy to get down to Lakeshore to drive east or west. A valet greeted us when we arrived and helped us with our bags. Parking is in an underground lot directly under the hotel - accessed by elevator, so I felt our car was very secure. At check in we were greeted warmly and told that we had been upgraded to one of their larger suites. They also informed us the crib we requested was waiting for us in our suite. Our suite (four - there are only five suites per floor) was spacious and on the 22nd floor, with a gorgeous view to the south of the lake, harbour and southern city skyline. It was a corner suite - the windows on the west faced directly into the building next door, the architecture of the building was interesting, but we found it best to keep the curtains drawn on that side (as they were when we entered the suite). The weather was cold and windy, so I only just stepped out briefly on the small balcony, but the view was spectacular. The suite itself was very clean - everything had a 'new' feeling to it - the hotel only opened in 2005. We definitely enjoyed having 2 televisions and the kitchenette (microwave, sink, stovetop, bar fridge and small dishwasher). There was ample counterspace and cupboards in the kitchen area. There was a washer and dryer in one closet, although we did not make use of them. The washroom was only stocked with enough towels for two and it was a challenge to know what to do with our wet towels...but the shower was very nice - good water pressure with a rain style shower head. The soaps, shampoo, conditioner, etc. were good quality, from the Shizen spa onsite. There were two fluffy robes as well. The main bed was wonderful - the sheets were lovely - high thread count. They put a selected semiprecious stone on the pillow (part of their Zen theme) each night at turndown. Unfortunately, even though we had booked the room for four, the sofa bed was not made up, nor was any bedding provided in the suite. Very soon after I called to the front desk though, a very pleasant man brought up the extra towels and bedding and he made the sofabed up very quickly for us. We enjoyed continental breakfast (included with our stay) in the hotel restaurant Doku 15 both mornings - Illy coffee, selection of teas, great fresh breads and pastries, smoked salmon, fresh fruit and very pleasant, helpful staff assisting. We did not try the restaurant for dinner - it just wasn't suited for young children in the evening. At checkout we discovered they had overcharged us for the valet parking (we were promised $20 per night, but the charge was $29 per night) and we did not receive the gift cards or the milk and cookies for the children in the evening promised with the Easter package. When I brought this to their attention, they comped the parking for the two nights, without any quibbling. Overall I would highly recommend this hotel, especially for stays longer than one or two nights. It is worth getting the premium view.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: JDP1232
Reviews.Content: Excellent stay at his beautiful boutique hotel... First class service, rooms, spa and restaurant. We enjoyed it tremendously and would HIGHLY RECOMMEND IT !!! Quiet and posh... Something you'd find in NY or LA.... a first for toronto!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Impressed”
Reviews.Author: YoungWorldTraveler
Reviews.Content: I had a chance to stay two nights at the Cosmo at the end of March and overall I was impressed. The room was spacious, however, for being an all suites property, it felt very spartan (though this does come with the Zen theme.) I can't say enough about the bed; my body melted every time I slept in it. Also, it was nice to have two televisions in the room, but they did go under utilized due to my constantly being out in the city. The location was great for a businessman, but for a younger person, it was a bit far from the night clubs that I wanted to visit. Everything in the room was as described online, and all but the air purifier worked. This wasn't a big loss to me, as I didn't require it, but should I have had allergies, it would have been an issue. Another small thing was the balcony. It wasn't so much a balcony, but a ledge with a glass wall. I couldn't even stand on it, and it seems they were put in to just claim to have a balcony. I was rather bothered by this, having recently been able to enjoy breakfast on my balcony at another hotel, and I enjoy waking up and eating outside. I would stay here again, but only if business was the reason for my trip. The luxury was amazing, but it is rather out of the way from the nightlife at Church Street.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: BusinessTravler
Reviews.Content: I have searched the web for a nice hotel to stay while in my business trip to Toronto, Booked a room from the website and that was it! It is in great located in downtown Toronto got a wonderful spa (shizen spa) And nice big rooms. I will defiantly go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Practice what you preach”
Reviews.Author: busytravelerScottsAz
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that markets itself as a zen retreat with it's primary purpose being rejuvenation and relaxation, this hotel fell abysmally short. My "view" room on the 17th floor had a view of a steel beam and a brick wall. My second room on the 9th floor had a floor to ceiling window in the bedroom that had blinds that were stuck in the "up" position. Of course, this wasn't realized until I tried to go to sleep on the first night. When I finally got someone to come up and help me, they rigged a sheet onto the window which let the sun in early the next morning. It took 2 days and 4 lifestyle managers before that was fixed. But that really didn't matter anyhow because the room was next to a loud generator that woke me up at 3 in the morning. After 3 nights of poor sleep, not having the basic amenities in the room such as creamer for coffee and lights that worked, I checked out early and found somewhere where I could actually "rejuvenate" from this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay at the Cosmo”
Reviews.Author: mangie
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Cosmopolitan Hotel the last weekend in February. Ultra cool & very modern hotel, just loved it. Check in & out was speedy & the staff was so warm & welcoming. We stayed in a suit & it felt just like a small apartment. Great corner room with lots of windows, but not that great of a view. We had a brick wall on one side & an okay street view on the other side, which was fine with us. The room consisted of a living room area, small kitchen, bathroom & a seperate bedroom. The bedding was awesome, so comfortable. The living room had a nice flat screen TV & a corner water fountain that was such a nice touch, loved the sound of the falling water, so relaxing. The kitchen had everything needed. Down the hallway, there was a small closet, washer & dryer & the bathroom. Loved the bathroom, so modern, awesome rain shower. The whole room was extremely clean & nicely appointed. We only had one problem, one of the bathroom mirror lights were out. We called down to the front desk & they said that they would be right up. Well, we ended up going out to dinner downstairs for a couple hours & when we came back, the light had not been fixed. We called again & someone was right up in 10 min. to fix it. Not a major problem, but its tough putting on makeup when only one side of the mirror has light. We did have dinner & drinks in the lobby restaurant Doku and enjoyed every bit of it. Cool modern decor, nice atmosphere. The service was incrediable & the food was just delicious. I definitely recommend it. All in all, we had a wonderful stay & would definitely stay here agian. This was a romantic weekend getaway for us & the Cosmopolitian delivered.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: MIRVISH
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 2 nights back in Feb and it was fantastic. quiet rooms beautiful decor great great staff and delicious high-end restaurant Doku 15. We saw some celebs ( But will respect their privacy and not disclose there names!) I can see why they would chose to stay here. It's cool, Zen and you have soooo much privacy and security with the swipe cards. You feel like you are in your own Condo the rooms have kitchens and it simulates a real home! grea hotel loved it and encourage any one to stay here as well.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo stay not so chic”
Reviews.Author: Jenn50000
Reviews.Content: This was in a great location!!! The staff were only o.k. We had a missing remote control, a light in the bathroom that didn't work, a sink pipe that broke, broken blind, and no turn down service. When we checked in, we were asked to select a scent for nighttime turndown. We never received turndown service or a newspaper during our three night stay. We called to have someone fix our tv and were told we were missing a remote. They replaced the remote. One of the bathroom lights broke and we called down. They said they would send someone up. No one came. On our way out, we stopped at the front desk. We were advised the maintenance man had left at 4, but the manager said she would go up and look at it. It still hasn't been fixed. Housekeeping was there at 4:45 so we went to the bar to have a drink. They said they opened at 5 and we would have to wait as they couldn't serve us early. We looked into reservations at the restaurant. We were told that they would call to let us know and no one called. This could be the fact that the restaurant and the hotel are owned separately and no one really cares about the other. We filled out a specific breakfast sheet stating simplicity of plain bagel, coffee, tea, and yogurt. We were given three seeded bages. This is a very nice hotel, amenities, and location. However, due to the average service, I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “This excellent zen hotel also requires you to be zen about its deficiencies”
Reviews.Author: seattletoamsterdam
Reviews.Content: What they got right: This hotel is centrally located in Toronto but is on a side street so there is almost no street noise. The staff was exquisitely polite and helpful. I felt like my needs were proactively met. Quite elegant service without seeming over eager. The suites are small apartments with a living room, small kitchen, bathroom, and separate bedroom. The decor is minimalist zen with hardwood floors, bowl sink in the bathroom, rain-style showerhead, a flatscreen TV in the bedroom and the living room area, bamboo in vases and a little mini fountain. Additional touches include a newspaper delivered every morning and little polished stones placed on your bed every night with a note that tells the "healing powers" of each stone. The room suites definitely create a scene of relaxation and serenity. My queen size japanese-style bed had four high quality pillows and was extremely comfortable. The towels were large and nice and the room comes with two bathrobes. WiFi is fast and stable and easy to connect to. The bar and restaurant downstairs is very nice. What they didn't get quite right: This boutique hotel goes over the top to create this theme of serenity, but there are some basics that they missed. Because these are suites, each room is pretty small. There is no place anywhere to put your suitcase. There is a hallway closet and some shelving in the bedroom. But the shelving is small. I had to put my suitcase on the barstool-chairs in the living/kitchen area. There are blinds instead of black-out curtains in the bedroom. While these are attractive, there was still light, and quite a bit of it, coming into my bedroom. The bathroom was pretty, but a disappointment. There is no counter space to put your toiletries. The water pressure in the shower was low and unsatisfying. And there is no bathtub. At least not in my sweet. There was more mildew in the grout than I was comfortable with. The gym is too small. One elyptical machine and One treadmill. The lighting in the gym was also too intensely bright. Overall, it was the hotel's services that made it great. The people behind the desk made reservations for my team at great restaurants, and called a towncar for me when I checked out without my having to ask. But the whole zen thing...you have to do as well as tell.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: DesignerGuy
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at this designer hotel when in Toronto attending a conference at the convention centre. What a gem!!! My suite was fantastic. Loved the ensuite kitchen, the modern and very stylish bathroom (which my wife wants me to replicate back here in Calgary), the wonderful bedding and the cool plasma TV. Restaurant on the property was fantastic. Recommend sitting at the bar and chatting with the friendly staff. They had some great suggestions for menu items to sample. Didn't get a chance to try out the spa due to my schedule but willo definitely do so on a return visit with my wife for a nice romantic getaway. Have been recommending this place to everyone. Very cool, hip hotel. Definitely worth the price. Hotel is located within walking distance of Hockey Hall of Fame, Eaton Centre, Union Station and the Toronto Convention Centre. Good restaurants nearby but recommend hanging out on property in their very cool Japanese restaurant. Who knows, you might run into some cool celebs.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed it”
Reviews.Author: traveltx
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I enjoyed this boutique hotel. The rooms are small, but clean and cozy. The modern decor and wood floors are a nice change. Their "lifestyle specialists" were very helpful with dining recommendations and directions. The Doku bar has a great atmosphere. And the Shizen spa is very relaxing. We would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to its name -- cool, cosmopolitan and quite an experience!”
Reviews.Author: eastcoastnomad
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I flew up to Toronto this past week for the film festival and found this hotel on Expedia. We had previously stayed in the Fairmont Royal York, a beautiful, if somewhat stuffy, old hotel, so our expectations were high. We weren't disappointed, even though our first impressions weren't the best. We walked into the small, dark, obviously trying to be very, very cool lobby and he whispered to me that perhaps the Fairmont still had room. Luckily, we gave the Cosmopolitan a chance beyond the dark entryway, the trendy pod-like hallways and the model-wannabes working the front desk. Our room was a delightful surprise. I've read other reviews suggesting the rooms were small. Wow. Not my experience at all. My room was as big as your typical NYC apartment. Really nice kitchen area, with microwave, dishwasher, fully stocked cabinets with glasses, etc. Washer/dryer in the closet -- that was a first for me, and I've stayed at a lot of great hotels. Calm, serene, lovely living room with a flat-screen TV, a super-comfy bed, nice orchids & zen touches. It was cool, comfortable and altogether a great experience. Other pluses -- well-stocked, relatively inexpensive minibar (compared to the Fairmont and similar, anyway); secure access to rooms (have to use your room key to get to your floor); small but fine fitness room. Minuses -- slow housekeeping; "too cool for school" vibe from a lot of the staff; no view from my room (concrete walls; "balcony" was 2 inches wide.) But overall, a superb experience, an outstanding walkable location, close to the CN building, the St. Lawrence Market, the Harbour, the entertainment district -- and for us, a good value with the $200 room rate we found on Expedia. I'm looking for excuses to go back!!

Reviews.Title: “Overrated, cramped and obnoxious”
Reviews.Author: sethdr
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Cosmopolitan the night of August 27th. We had reserved for 2 more nights but checked out early due to the problems we had. On a positive note, the room was immaculately clean, the decor was modern and beautiful, and the room was well-appointed. However, our room was called a "Premium Studio Suite" which sounded like it would be very spacious, yet it was anything but. It must also be noted that this hotel is a tiny, vertical building with only 5 rooms on each floor and very low ceilings (so low that the "Exit" sign in the hall is mounted in a corner so you don't bump your head). The photos on their website are very decieving. The sleeping area was barely big enough for a queen-sized bed, in fact, if it had a regular TV instead of a flat panel, there would not be enough room to walk around the bed. Our photos show the real size of the room as compared to those on their website. Between the uncomfortable bed and the constant, loud noises we could hear from the alley, we barely got any sleep at all. The label "suite" is deceiving because there is no separate sitting area, just a tiny kitchenette (unless you pay for one of the more expensive suites). In the morning, all the hotel could offer us was to move us to a more expensive suite. We decided instead to check out and moved across the street to the Suites at One King West, which were much more spacious; our room was comfortable and very quiet, and comparably priced. I cannot recommend the Cosmopolitan to anyone especially for the $200 + we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmopolitan is definitely a must-stay hotel”
Reviews.Author: SJack
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very cool. It is right downtown close to all the theatres, restaurant and night clubs. The service is fantastic, from the moment you are greeted at the door. The rooms are very clean and everything just works. I would definitely recommend staying at the Cosmo if you are in Toronto. Also, you shouldn't stay there without eating at the restaurant in the lobby - Doku. I know there are a lot of restaurants in the area and you don't always want to stick to the hotel restaurant, but this is different. It is amazing food, excellent service and the bar is a great place to hang out once you're done dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: rosaliek
Reviews.Content: Just stayd at the Cosmopolitan hotel and have to say its a great jewel. From check in to check out staff were very helpful and always there to give a hand and recomend places to go to as we are from out of town. The room was very comfortable and not stuffy like other hotels that have only the Ac going but no window to open and get some air. Having a balcony is a huge plus you do not see in other hotels. The amenities are top notch. You must visit the spa as it was one of outr best experiances in toronto. from the amazing setting to the treatment rooms and the therapiest it is like no other.

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was recently in Toronto staying at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. I was referred to this hotel by a friend who had stayed there and suggested that I try it since they enjoyed it so much. The service was amazing from the time I was greeted at the door for check-in, until the time I left the hotel. The staff are pleasant and helpful but don't get in the way. The rooms were very modern and stylish. I had a fantastic meal at the restaurant Doku located in the lobby of the hotel. Even if I wasn't staying at the hotel, I'd recommend going to the hotel just for the restaurant. They served very creative sushi and other Japenese inspired dishes, unlike any I've tasted elsewhere. All the ingredients were fresh and the food came very quickly. Plus the atmosphere and style of the restaurant was very unique. This place is worth checking out.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I loved this new boutique hotel. I spend a lot of time in Toronto for business and am always on the look out for great new places to stay. The Cosmopolitan is a small boutique hotel right in the middle of the business district. It is within walking distance to many restaurants and local attractions as well. Public transit is also around the corner. I also had the chance to stay through the weekend and enjoyed a great Sunday brunch in the hotel's restaurant. Friendly service, clean rooms, onsite spa and great location. I'll definitely be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Spa”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Had an amazing experience at the Cosmopolitan's Shizen Spa. My husband gave me a gift certifcate for our anniversary and it was truly fantastic. Had the most amazing facial there from Irit - I highly recommend her. But also had treatments (massage and pedicure) from other staff members who were really good too. All very professional and nice. The spa is very clean with lots of private treatment rooms and in the most relaxing atmosphere. It was so peaceful and serene in there that I fell asleep during the massage. I have sensitive skin and often am hesitant to try new products but the ones they used were very high quality and natural that caused no reaction with my skin. They also give you access to the hot whirpool so you can continue to relax and offered access to the gym as well but I was more interested in relaxing then working out! If you need to relax for a few hours then this is the place to do it. The hotel/spa is very conveniently located near King & Yonge Street in Toronto, a very central part of the city. I can't wait to come back and stay longer so I can try even more of the treatments. A special thanks to my husband Brad for this special treat - Happy Anniversary!

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmopolitan at the beginning of June and can't wait to go back. I was travelling for business and usually I stay at the Sheraton but I heard a while back that the Cosmopolitan was one of the top 10 hotels in the world so I decided to give it a shot. I was not disappointed! From the minute I entered the lobby (small I might add) I felt like I was in a serene place. The front desk agent was extremely friendly and professional. He gave me some wonderful suggestions on where I should go for dinner. I went to the spa for a manicure and pedicure and I was pampered like I have never been before. I didn't want to leave. The room I was in was absolutely beautiful, however, there was not much room in the bathroom to put my toiletries. The view was good (looking over nearby buildings) and my favourite part was the duvet in the room. I felt like I was sleeping on a cloud. All in all, this is my new place to stay when travelling to Toronto. The service is outstanding, the location is perfect and the staff are wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjouyed our Stay at the Cosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: KyleA
Reviews.Content: I have to say that my experience at the Cosmopolitan was a lot better than some of the reports on here. Having stayed at the sister hotel (Pantages) and Hotel Le Germain downtown we stayed here and found it to be enjoyable. Our room had plenty of windows, 3 tall ones in the bedroom, more in the liviing room plus balcony, and even one beside the breakfast bar. The living room had a nice flat panel tv as well as another smaller one in the bedroom. The balcony was small, but usable to stand out there and check out the view. The view requested was a lake view higher level which is exactly what we got. I think staying in Toronto as a tourist or even as a local one must remember that unless your hotel is right on the lake, lake view usually means partial because of the higher surrounding buildings everywhere. My suggestion is to check out the location of the building with regards to its closeness to the lake. The decor is fairly modern and contemporary. The kitchen is a good size with room for 2 dinner settings and then some, a stove top, mini fridge, toaster, and i believe there was a microwave. Front desk staff was good, met the requests on our reservations and checked us in 2 hours before the 3pm check in time. When we pulled up no one was outside to get our bags, we only had two smaller overnight bags though. If you pull up and no one is there to help, you can simply go in and ask and someone will most likely help you with your luggage. Room service was quick to give us a menu when one wasn't present in our room and was prompt, quick, and pleasant when delivering it. The Cosmpolitan uses Hot House as their room service food. We ate at Doku in the hotel and it was "probably" an enjoyable meal. I say probably only because we aren't huge Japanese food fans and it was mainly sushi and Japanese dishes so I can't make a fair judgment call on how the food was because i wouldn't know what makes good Japanese food to begin with. I can say the waiter was really helpful with food choices, reccommendations, and explanations if we asked any questions. The food was fresh, presented very well and we were even given free Saki to to sample. Overall it was a great experience and I'd go back again.

Reviews.Title: “embarrassing”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first occasion I have been motivated to write a review on Trip Advisor having used its resources for some time. So , what triggered a critique from me? A feeling of being swindled and conned after three nights at the Cosmopolitan. We too booked this new establishment following a positive listing in Conde Nast, and I admit, superficially, it would seem to have the goods - convenient location , boutique aesthetic, enticing website.But as soon as we arrived , we were gobsmacked by a welcome which seemed to say ' Oh, some people have walked through our front door. Should they be here?'. In fact, nothing was said at all and it was up to us to politely indicate we had a reservation Having just come from stays in Quebec at the Gault in Montreal and the Dominion in Quebec City, where front desk staff were so positively charming, friendly and helpful, we were completely underwhelmed to say the least. This attitude extended to no attempt to help with luggage and an incredibly lukewarm response following any subsequent contact with the staff through the stay. Their only concern seemed to be which calming essential oil we desired in our room of an evening. The breakfast personnel had obviously partaken of these excessively. Oh, and I suppose we should comment on the room. We elected to have one of the higher floor suites, for which one pays a substantial premium due to the supposed wonderful view. Lets say heart rates did not quicken a cent when the curtains were parted. Quickly one could determine a cost-cutting ethos had been implemented in constructing this hotel. The door to the bedroom was barely more than plywood and would not close properly. There was room enough for a kitchenette but obviously not enough for anything more than a standard double bed (forget king, let alone queen) nor for any shelf space in the bathroom to fit more than a glass of water. The 'balconies' were just unfinished concrete slab protruding from the room. Plasma TVs were in both living room and bedroom but the screen quality and channel selection meant they were both virtually unwatchable. We did have nice cocktails at the bar one night but at $1200 for 3 nights , that's alot to pay for a nice drink. Mind you, beware. Upon presentation of the bill, you are told the bar is a separate financial concern to the hotel and you cannot charge them to your room. An insult from start to finish.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: Chollero
Reviews.Content: In all my many years of travel never have I had a more unsatisfacory expience--at $400 a night. On checking in I was told I had made two reservations and would be charged for both rooms--on checking out the hotel admitted it had made a mistake. My room on the 23rd floor had only a view of the buildings across the street. My suite was small, no room for a chair or sofa. My businress associate and I had to sit on the bed, but the large kitchen area had a washer and drier. The washbasin did not drain. The light on the small desk did not work. When I checked out there were food items on the bill that I had not consumed. The hotel is hard to find and many cabdrivers had never heard of it. In a financal district a zen-oriented hotel seems out of place. Beware.

Reviews.Title: “Staff nice but incompetent - rooms chic but noisy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The rooms are small and subject to pretty substantial hallway noise (doors slamming, people talking) and the clientele seems to include an abnormal number of young hipsters, slightly seedy in a club-going kind of way. The staff are friendly but not overall very good. Wake-up calls, for example, were late. Also, I have some chemicals sensitivities and had asked that no cleaning chemicals be used in my room. They assured me this was no problem, but seemed to not have mentioned it to housekeeping, who had no idea of my request. Better still, after several reminders of the chemical issue, I came back one afternoon to find my room smelling of the most potent oil paint odors and a man immediately outside my room painting a door in the hallway. The smell was incredible, like an oil spill. When I called down to ask them to stop right away, the hotel staff member said, "I'll put in that request". I would never consider staying here ever again.

Reviews.Title: “Average to Sub-par”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I'm going to organize this review by category. Just to give a bit of perspective on where I'm coming from, I'm a professional in my early twenties - the demographic this hotel is apparently trying to serve. SERVICE: Service was sort of akward. Pretty much everyone was about my age and they seemed kind of impersonal. I read a bunch of the other reviews before staying here, and I have to say that they seemed much more knowledgeable at this point in time - I got my incense delivered as promised. There is no more complimentary breakfast, as a sidenote. All in all, service did everything they were supposed to, I just didn't like their mannerism. ROOM: It looks pretty nice at first glance, but the sheets are nowhere near a good thread count. The bed was comfy enough but it sort of felt like a fouton. The plasma TV's were NOT of good quality. Not much room for clothing but lots of kitchen space. I was dissapointed that even the yoga videos were 9 bucks a pop, I'm not sure if this is commonplace. The fountain had an off switch thankfully, because it make me think i had left a tap running somewhere. OVERALL: Had some appetizers at Doku, quite tasty and pricey (tuna tacos were especially delish). Personally, i think they overcharge for its apparent "boutique" appeal. You could stay in a much comfier room with more value added at a similar price somewhere else. Of course it might not be as "cool" as the Cosmo so it's up to you. I stayed early in the week so I didn't see what the night crowd was like later in the week. I personally would probably not stay here again. It's just not worth 250 bucks a night in my opinion... SHIZEN: I felt that my spa lady could have been more experienced. The chairs aren't comfortable (for manicure/pedicure).

Reviews.Title: “I had to see it for myself”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a hotel savy reading that Toronto recieved its only hotel in Canada to be voted among 60 best hotels of the world in the Conde Nast Magazine. I decided to spaend the weekend at the Cosmopolitan Hotel. As I enterd the hotel I immidiatly got the first great vibe that I am not in down town Toronto but in a world of tranquility. The receptionist Adam was very knowlagable and gave a calmenss feeling to me and my wife when seeking more information about the Hotel amenities and things to do in the erea. The room was a number 4 room with a lake view. The room is amazingly spacy with a the sounds of the fountain just asking you to melt into the couch and relax to its sounds. The room was equipped wih every object one can need in a hotel room from frige to stove washer/dryer and flat screen TV's. The decor is so clean and in place that I even requested to know who was the designer for the rooms. also teh bed was ultra comfurtable with an ionizer in the room. The next morning we both had a couples massage in the spa, the most beautiful room to have a massage in we didnt want to leave. In the evning we had dinner at the Restaurant Doku the best Japanese style cuisine I had ever tried and the crowd!! amazing like I was part of a celeb movie premier. Now I can see why Conde Nast chose this Hotel. I guess

Reviews.Title: “Chic minimalist design”
Reviews.Author: NYLivetotravel
Reviews.Content: My significant other and I stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel for one night this Easter weekend. The quiet location on a small side street in downtown Toronto was conveniently located to most attractions and the subway but parking is limited and expensive. You're better off parking at the lot down the street. The hotel is contemporary and chic and was a great value for the price we received on Expedia. We booked a one-bedroom suite, which was more like a studio suite to me, located on one of the lower floors of the hotel. The suite was decorated in a simple, modern, but elegant style with some unexpected ammenities such as an en suite washer and dryer. The view on the lower floors is pretty bad, but perhaps they get more interesting on the higher floors. The service was friendly and courteous. Definitely recommended for singles, couples and business travelers, but not families as the room was a bit small for more than two people. Would have loved to stay longer to check out the spa and the hotel's newly-opened restaurant/bar but maybe next time. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: WOW!! From the moment I entered the serene Cosmopolitan hotel I felt calm!! This boutique hotel in Downtown Toronto definitely sets a precedence unlike any other hotel I have stayed in. From the rooms to the staff to the new restaurant DOKU 15, I did not want to leave! Doku 15 was a cullinary experience that I will never forget. when you walk in you are greeted by professional staff that take pride in their new restaurant, sit and have a drink at the bar ( and do try one of their sakitinis...unlike any other I've tried!) You look around and are surrounded by one of the hottest crowds of good looking people in one room! The decor is absolutely stunning! Then came the food... Tapas style with a fusion concept. Each bite was mouth watering! And because things are made to share the whole restaurant gets a very intimate feeling of warmth and good times. Although not cheap.... It was definitely worth every penny. I am still thinking about their signature sushi, the Doku 15! I would highly recommend this hotel and restaurant to any one and every one. 10 out 10!! congrats Cosmopolitan and Doku 15! You have set a standard that will be hard to replicate.

Reviews.Title: “Out of this World”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Pantges hotel and spa. Covenient location. Clean, confortable, updated rooms. Staff was very helpful and attentive to our needs. the spa was "Out of this World!" We could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough about the service and staff at the "Cosmo." My wife and I live in Toronto and wanted some place special to stay on our wedding night. We stayed at the Cosmo on the recommendation of a friend, and we were not disappointed. The staff had all of the finishing touches in place when we arrived - candles, champagne, rose petals!! It was truly romantic and my wife loved it. They even went so far as to order us cheeseburgers at 3:00am (we were starved!!) The room was great - luxurious linens and fantastic views of the lake. We will certainly stay there whenever we can. A special thanks to the lifestyle crew who helped make it a great night!

Reviews.Title: “Next time I'm going to bring my wife with me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: been in the hotel for business because of the vicinity to the center of town the staff was wonderful, the room was clean and had exactly what I needed the vicinity P.A.T.H (Toronto under ground city) made the cold Toronto winter a lot easier to cote with and the spa was something else! Next time I'm going to bring my wife with me (this time for a nice vacation)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hideaway Hotel for Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Was satisfied with 2 night business trip at Cosmopolitan. Was surprised to find a washer/dryer with detergent available in the 1 bedroom suite. I stayed on 8th floor, suite 3 that was booked through expedia for $143/night. Cheaper than the the King Edward Le Royal Meridien... The hotel still needs a fully functioning bar/restaurant and there was still construction work for the ever-developing Shizen spa... but otherwise, if you need a place close to businesses in area, you won't go wrong with Cosmopolitan. The complimentary breakfast was satisfactory - oj, tea, coffee, milk with fruit (cut up & apples/bananas) as well as croissants/mini-muffins... The location is central - the next block up is the Drug Mart where you can buy items (microwave ready food) for the microwave or fridge... Up the block on Yonge, are lots of fast food restaurants (McDonalds, Quizno's, Mamma Mia Pizza) and a mall next to The Bay Dept store.... Because its close to all the banks on King St West, there are plenty of cabs to hail for different areas around Toronto. This is not a full-service hotel but if you like privacy and some modern amenities and like to make your own travel/dinner plans, Cosmopolitan is a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: An exceptionally immaculate, lovely and gracious retreat! We loved the perfect location in the centre downtown Toronto! warm welcome and the superb manner. Absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Amateur operation, untrained staff. In one word, Awkward”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If anything can be said about this hotel it is awkward... the room layout is awkward, the staff are awkward and even getting to the place is awkward! The staff are in definite need of training, when you call to make a reservation, they ask for your first name and call you by it throughout. I personally would rather them address me by Sir or Mr. Smith than use my first name! Both times I called reservations, the agent's tone of voice and pitch was up and down and the one woman repeated that she could not guarantee rates beyond this conversation (which I think is rediculous, hotel's don't employ that dynamic of a rate structure)! Getting to the hotel was something else, it is tucked away off a major street and has absolutely ZERO signage from any major artery. At night it is coloured this horrid green from major spotlights and is located on a dark street with no other traffic, as a woman traveller it was seedy to say the least! The check-in was silly, the agent seemed new, or needed more training. I requested a high-floor with a nice view, to which I was told "sure"! Where do they have me? 10th floor of a much taller building. The room itself was okay, but forget about entertaining or having room to lay your stuff out. The chairs are vinyl, the floors are laminate, not hardwood... so DONT let the other reviews fool you, those people must not know the difference between genuine hardwood and a big wood sticker! This hotel is trying desperately to be a chic boutique style establishment, but the staff and presumably management don't know the first thing about this style of accommodations. This place is a real joke and I recommend everyone steer clear. Even though it is not a boutique hotel, I will return to my perennial favourite, the InterContinental on Bloor Street as there are no viable boutique options in Toronto... yet.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend in Toronto.The Cosmopolitan is in a great location, a couple minute walk from Eaton Centre and a bunch of theaters. We stayed in the regular suite, it comes with a fully equipped kitchen and it even has a mini dishwasher! Hardwood (Laminate) floors are a definite plus for those who don't like carpet. Great for those who are there on extended business stays, they offer complimentary wireless internet access and it is quite easy to access as long as you have a wireless card on your laptop. They offer 24 hour valet service . Within walking distance to many local area attractions. Very easy to get to if you are flying into Pearson. Has a full service spa on the 4th floor that is open from 9am to 9pm weekdays. I would definitely stay there again next time I am in town. Staff was also helpful and friendly which is for me very important.

Reviews.Title: “What a Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The lifestyle management team was excellent. The service was great, the room was extremely comfortable, and the extra amenities were a nice touch. The restaurant wasn't open yet, but the lifestyle management team went through great lengths to ensure we were taken care of. I'll be going back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Great idea, but a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: Randy&Lynn
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights over American Thanksgiving weekend. We got a great rate through Travelzoo, although the upgrade was less than promised. The restaurant still isn't open, so the breakfast was one of the worst continental breakfasts I've seen in a hotel. The spa is open now, and it is great. I had a great massage and my wife had a facial and manicure which she said was also great. The room was definitely sleek, modern and very tasteful. The big problem is a lack of seating, poor lighting, and almost no storage for clothes. There is a washer and dryer for long stays, but the closet is about 18" wide and a similar bank of shelves for clothes. We paid for an upgrade to a one-bedroom suite, the biggest room they have. I don't think we got it, although the desk staff seemed confused. The bed was in an alcove off the "seating" area. The seating area was two chairs that faced each other and were not convenient for TV viewing. The kitchen area is nice, but there aren't any grocery stores nearby. Our city view looked directly into an office. There was no balcony. For the price we paid (about $120 US) the room was very nice. At rack rates, I'd stay somewhere else. All of the zen features don't make up for a lack of comfortable living space.

Reviews.Title: “Cosmo Toronto, A Perfect Oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Cosmopolitan Hotel! We are a young, professional couple from Detroit- went for a long weekend. This hotel was the perfect size, immaculately clean, with friendly and knowledgeable staff. Awesome stylish bathroom, nice and thoughtful touches everywhere like the bamboo slippers and the stones on the pillows instead of chocolates. Made me smile each time we walked in! Oh, and the Lifestyle Mangers..... they know what they're talking about! Knew exactly what we were looking for, and gave us the best info ever. Will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “the ultimate in comfort and sophistication”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Even hailing from the New York City area, this hotel far exceeded my expectations in terms of sophistication and comfort. The room was like a chic Manhattan 1-bedroom that you might find covered in Metropolitan Home magazine. There was a soothing zen water fountain and calming music playing when we entered the room. The kitchen is more than adequate and also beautifully designed. The bed was like a big cloud to sleep in! And we didn't use the 2 plasma tvs but they were a nice touch. The Bvlgari bath and body products and fluffy white robes were very nice (to say the least!) too. I knew that this hotel was supposed to be sleek, but for the price point I figured it would be "nice" at best. We didn't know that it was a "soft opening", hence the great price. But that simply meant that the spa facilities and restaurant were not yet open. No biggie for us. If I have to say anything negative, it would be that our view wasn't anything special (but it didn't matter to me anyhow). And yes, the balconies are small- not worth going on. We had a very quiet room on the 25th floor- no noise to complain of at all. So upon realizing what a gem our room was, my spouse and I prompty decided to order sushi to-go and eat in the room. When we couldn't locate an open liquor stores, the concierge service at Cosmopolitan was more than happy to have a bottle of wine sent to our room for a mere $20 Canadian. Perhaps I haven't been staying at the right hotels, but this place was beyond belief! 14 hours after settling in with our sushi dinner in the room we decided that we had might as well start to explore the city of Toronto and reluctantly hand in our key card to check out. Within walking distance from Cosmopolitan was the Eaton Centre mall, and lots of shopping. Queens Quay is pretty close too but I'd recommend taking a car there. I'm sad to say that I probably won't be able to afford this wonderful hotel by the time I find myself back in Toronto. I believe that their restaurant should be ready in December 05 so I'm sure the rates will double or triple around then! But stay here if you want the ultimate in comfort and sophistication. Even when the rates go up, it will surely be worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thefranchize
Reviews.Content: Just spent a weekend at the Cosmopolitan, and I really have nothing to complain about. The valet parking was full, which was a little inconvienient, but you can park down about 1 block for $20 for 24 hours, which is okay if you don't need to take your car out. If you don't have to leave the city, you're better to park your car and cab it around anyway, because you're going to have to pay to park your car everywhere you go in the city. The room was excellent, booked through expedia ($150 CAD a night) which is more than reasonable considering other prices in Toronto for nothing special. We did receive complimentary toiletries, and robes, and everything that was described on the website, and the maid service was great. We arrived late afternoon freshened up and went out for dinner. Back at the hotel by 10:00ish, and the maid service had already come in. I was very surprised. On the 12th floor, right near the elevator. Room was very quiet, continental breakfast was very decent, and the staff was very friendly and helpful. I've stayed at many hotels in Toronto, and I would place the Cosmopolitan right at the top myself. I really have nothing bad to say about the Cosmopolitan.

Reviews.Title: “Has potential, inconsistent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights here. There are five rooms to a floor. Make sure you get a suite. There is one room per floor that is absolutely, unacceptably small and does not have anywhere near the amenities or touches that the hotel touts on their website. They also mention the designer bath products. Well, either they ran out of those or they don't provide them for people who book their stays through a third party service. Neither I nor my friends received any. I understand they are still in a "soft opening" stage, but there are certain levels of service that must be met. If you are going to provide a certain level of housekeeping, turndown etc, on one day, then you must follow through on each day thereafter. This hotel has a lot of potential to be a very nice, very relaxing escape. But they will certainly need to lift their level of professional service if they wish to build and maintain a loyal customer base. All in all, after moving to the bigger room, I enjoyed my stay. The sleek lines and uncluttered rooms enhance the relaxation factor. I suspect they are still ironing out the kinks, and eventually it will truly be a luxurious place on all levels. I will grant to them that they extended courtesy of a fabulous grand opening party during my stay. I am sure this event took a lot of resources to plan and implement and may have overextended the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay and value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cosmopolitan Hotel in Toronto in October 2005. It exceeded all our expectations, and we recommended it higly. The rooms were decorated very tastfully, and of superior quality.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Great hospitality from check in to check out (Thanks ADAM). SUITE was on 26th floor with great lakeside view. Very clean - extremely comfortable. The linens and pillows were top of the line, my wife and I did not want to get out bed. Disappointed HOT TUB was not functional yet - NEXT TIME for sure. Our Lifestyle Manager - DARRIN was very professional and accomodating to our special requests given it was our 5th year anniversary. ENJOY ALL ASPECTS - did not want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “STOP- Don't Sign On The Dotted Line!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin?! I have never had such a horrible experience at a hotel in all of my travels. It's ironic that the entire theme of this hotel is relaxation, when in fact, it is the hotel that caused 99% of our stress on this trip. First off, when I made reservations, I asked specifically if there would be a sofa-bed. The answer: yes. In actuality: no. It was also the first question that I asked upon checking-in, only to be told that the suite that I booked did not have a sofa-bed and that it would cost an add'l $50 in addition to the $430+/2 nights (CA) that we were already paying; that's outrageous!! It's a good thing I thought ahead and came prepared w/ an inflatable queen- size bed and, believe it or not, it was 10x more comfortable than the bed in the room- be careful as you might break a rib if jumping on it too fast. (Note- there wasn't any sofa at all in our so-called "suite", only two chairs) When I called down for extra blankets- I was brought one and told that I could not have a second, that is until I complained!! Second, who ever heard of a hotel that does not provide parking, minimally for their guests??? We got directed to go to a ramp down the street who then re-directed us out because they too, had no parking!! We had to park 4 blocks away and what did we get, an in-sincere apology!! My opinion of this: the workers should give up one of their prime parking spots so the guests can park!! Third- the room is not nearly as spacious, soothing, relaxing, etc as they make it out to be. Have to keep your belongings and toiletries packed, as there is nowhere to put them besides kitchenette drawers!! For # four, I will list various problems. The refrigerator was locked when we first got there??; once unlocked, we loaded up our soda, taco salad, etc only to come back from a walk and realize it didn't work. We had to call our "lifestyle manager" who attempted to fix the fridg but couldn't, so offered to put our food items in someone else's fridge- are you kidding me?? That's gross!! We had to throw out the entire salad for risk of food-borne illness. Don't expect to need ice because there is no such thing as an ice machine down the hall- you need to call your "lifestyle manager" only to receive enough for 2-3 drinks. The hall light didn' t work, the balcony is big enough to fit one foot sideways, was told I couldn't have add'l extra towels/washcloths despite the fact we had denied housekeeping service the day before, and just because relaxation is their theme, I didn't even get the incense scent that they specifically asked to to pick!! But don't worry- you do receive a complimentary meditation CD. There isn;t enough music to calm me down at this hotel!! Not done yet!! Upon check-out, as I had done throughout my stay, I expressed my pure dissatisfaction w/my stay. Not once was I offered any monetary compensation, despite the obvious faults of the hotel. The reason, I booked through a third-party!! You have got to be kidding- a problem is a problem no matter how I booked the room!! To top it all off, I was denied any form of a receipt (I needed it to get across the border to get my GST tax back). Appearently, they don't give receipts. If you ask me, something is shady about this place. In the end- I wouldn't recommend this hotel for my goldfish to stay at!!

Reviews.Title: “urban bliss stay now before it gets too expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Tixilix
Reviews.Content: Just back from canada. Stayed three nights at the Cosmopolitan and it was bliss. We paid for a city view room studio but were given a lake view one bedroom apartment. The apartment was spotless, huge television, great bathroom with Bulgari toiletries, coffee maker and kitchenette, incense to burn, relaxation cds and cd player, turn down service with healing crystals rather than chocolate, bathrobes. All this and more for $149 a night a real bargain! Im sure we would not be able to afford to go there when its fully open, my advice is to take advantage now of the opening prices. Also the location is excellent and the hotel is quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish Zen Relaxation...Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Cosmo over this past weekend and it was a great experience. The modern construction and design of the rooms are clean and fresh - a welcome feel compared to other hotels that seem stuck in more conservative lanes. Instantly I felt welcome at the Cosmo and had excellent service throughout my stay. Although it has not been fully completed (restaurant) I am defenitly going back to check that out - I'm sure it will add to the overall expereience as a zen oasis right in the heart of Toronto. elyk

Reviews.Title: “A very stylish & hip hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is great hotel! My wife and I loved the Asian theme and modern styled rooms. Our suite was very spacious, had a beautiful balcony overlooking the harbour and provided us with plenty of room for entertaining guests before heading out on the town. We also really appreciated our lifestyle manager - more hotels need to provide personal service like this. Overall, we had a great time and would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a room with a little style!

Reviews.Title: “Could stay there forever!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night over the Labour day Weekend. I enjoyed my stay very much. The modern apt feel when we walked into our room made us instantly feel at home. The staff were friendly, and eager to help with dining suggestions and any other requests we had. granted the hotel is not complete, but you are soo close to everything downtown it doesnt matter at all. Cant wait to go back when the spa is complete for a week of pampering and relaxation. NP

Reviews.Title: “Urban Chic”
Reviews.Author: pdurbin
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location, staff, decor, amenities, I can't recommend this hotel high enough, from the dream beds, to the modern decor, the friendly, courteous and helpful staff, inroom robes, luxury bath products. flat screen tv's , mini kitchens..............Perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience ever!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dexcor
Reviews.Content: Please avoid this overated cheap condo building. It aims to portray itself as a stylised boutique hotel - yet has the smallest bedrooms in the city. The washer/dryers are larger than the bedrooms. Why so much space is devoted to the kitchen area when there is nowhere to sit in your room or even in the sitting area. The bathroom can only fit 1 person, let alone any toiletries. Yet the staff think they are working in the ultimate swanky fashion house. It is clearly designed for long stay corporates, hence the apt condo experience which is not a problem, but don't masquerade as a full service luxury hotel. Clearly it is not.

Reviews.Title: “Are employees writing this hotels other reviews???”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After discovering this website my husband and I chose this hotel based on the reviews on this website. I must say that I was thoroughly disapointed with the product we received... which makes me wonder what all these other people are talking about. The room was smaller than what I expected, especially the bedroom and the bathroom. I could hardly brush my teeth in the bathroom without hitting my elbows on the walls. The bathrobes provided were like wearing heavy-duty sandpaper... which is preculiar for a new hotel, perhaps they acquired them used. Needless to say, they were extremely uncomfortable. I can't imagine how anyone could do business in this place because not only is there a small, poorly lit and designed work desk, it does not have an ergonomic working chair. I've read so many great reviews about the helpful staff... but my husband and I can't disagree more. The valet was surly and slow, there was NO concierge that either of us could see, perhaps they weren;t on duty the three days, two nights we were there... and the front desk was just ok.. but I've run into more professional and friendly reception agents at Holiday Inns. All in all, I wonder about the reviews of this place. I was extremely disapointed and will chose to stay elsewhere in the future and I would strongly advise others do the same!

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about this hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for 23 days. The employees were wonderful in every way. They went out of there way to make my stay as comfortable as possible. I was there for medical reasons hence there were days that i was not feeling well at all. Every day however when leaving the hotel at least one of the workers managed to make me smile and made me feel at home. They were very helpful with giving me information about what to do in Toronto. My room was nothing less than perfect. Yes i agree with the other reviews that some things were not fully functional when i was staying there ie the resturant, however this was completely clear to me when i was making the reservation. I am planning on going to Toronto again at the end of the month and i don't want to stay anywhere else other than this hotel. I too like one of the other reviewers went to the Hilton hotel on my last night and it is true that they had in room dinning however the room itself does not compare to the Cosmopolitan. Overall i have nothing bad to say about this hotel and if anything i would like to thank them for making my stay as comfortable as possible. Thank you!

Reviews.Author: pado84
Reviews.Content: Even hailing from the New York City area, this hotel far exceeded my expectations in terms of sophistication and comfort. Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Modern!”
Reviews.Author: dngrockstar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel at the end of July, and although most of the features listed on it's online description were not complete yet, the stay was pleasant. The staff was incredibly polite and helpful. I was given a tour of my room and also given a complimentary relaxation CD. The room included a well equipped kitchen, with plates, cooking utensils, wine glasses, a fridge and microwave. There was also a flat screen television, cd player, washer and dryer, air purifier, and serenity fountain. The decor was chic and modern with hard wood floors and modern furniture. The bathroom was very modern with a glass shower, and a bowl-like sink. It was filled with Bvlgari bath products along with slippers. The lighting in the room gave it a nice serene feel. The continental breakfast included a selection of healthy choices like fruits, muffins, cereal and juices. The hotel is situated off a quiet street close to a busy intersection, which made me forget that I was in the middle of downtown Toronto. It's ideal to get valet parking here since I really didn't notice any parking lots around the hotel. The valet attendants were very prompt in retrieving my car for me. I was very satisfied with my stay at The Cosmopolitan and I would definitely return again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: bgff
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in July for 2 days and my husband and I were thrilled. The Hotel is in a great location. Our room was a little bit small, but everything was in there, a compl. kitchen incl. washing machine and dryer and very clean. Breakfast was good (bagels, fruits, pastries...) The Cosmopolitan has its own different style, very modern. We would stay here again. The only disadvantage is parking. They only offer valet parking for $30, or you have to park in an other parking garage for less.

Reviews.Title: “Awful. not for me”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As other reviewers have said, this hotel is nice to look at... but it wasn't functional. The hallways are bright and rainbow coloured and very hard on the eyes. It didn't add anything to the hallways and just made you feel like you were in a fun house. The rooms were much along the same lines. A fountain and light in the room ran all night long and I couldn't shut it off. The bathroom has an opaque glass door that isn't opaque enough for my liking. You can still make out clearly what is going on on the otherside of the door. There were no cleaning products to do your own dishes, but they did provide a dishwasher (which I guess is ornamental seeing the lack of detergent). Staff are marginal, the view isn't anything special if you are located on the backside of the hotel (it faces into a concreate square with buidlings all the way around... nothing tranquil abotu it. Especially since there was a party on the condo terrace right beneath our balcony!) Avoid this place, its for people who think they are cutting edge.

Reviews.Title: “loved the atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: as a writer i tend to find special places that give me inspiration for writing my novels. the cosmopolitan is one of those place, designed in good taste and filled with aromatic health, after relaxing for a whole day i started writing and continued for 5-days in a row. i hope now to finish my book even outside of the hotel but hope to get back soon.

Reviews.Title: “amazing grace”
Reviews.Author: arniman
Reviews.Content: this botique hotel is the freshest concept around - you just have to cheak it yourself + the service is great and the beds are oh so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is the first time I've written a review of a hotel, but I felt I needed to after reading the recent very poor review. It made me wonder if that person was staying at the same hotel. I was at the Cosmo a week or so after it opened in June. Despite the fact they had probably opened the doors a little early, it was still one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. The room and the staff were both exceptional. Can't think of anything negative to say - I'll be making a return visit in a couple of weeks.

Reviews.Title: “my wife was happy and so was i”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: after spending my 5th honeymoon at the pantages i felt so energised and free, that i felt saddned when i saw it is time to leave. the service is fast and eager to help, the hotel is desgined fablousley, and the spa is something that cant really be explained in words, you just have to visit the cosmo as fast as you can.

Reviews.Title: “DISASTER ZONE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel from hell for a couple of days. I had to leave 1 night early as by that time, I was a complete basket case from this experience. It had nothing to do with the staff, bless their poor souls. Or any of the people, but rather, they advertised one thing on the internet and I received the opposite. My room had no ventilation. The bathroom was abnormally small. The bed had a winter blanket on it with 34 celsius heat wave. There were no fans available to plug in. There were no menus, no list of services, no restaurant, no bar, absolutely flimsy and bizarre lighting in the room. It sured looked good on the internet when I booked, think of that, some relaxing days at this supposedly Japanese retreat. My TV was so far away from the bed I couldn't watch TV in bed. The cool mahogany screen to give me privacy actually fell off the wall and landed on the bed, this is a 75 pound wooden door type screen! There were no curtains at all and the blinds made the room extremely dark, although the room was already dark. The hotel is still under renovation and construction, with piles of materials on floors and a danger zone. All the services advertised were not nearly complete. I checked into the Hilton at the airport for my final day. What a difference. And it was the same price! Except that the Hilton provided food, beer in my room, menus, phone books, and everything else a tourist needs. Really what a rip off. I even phoned the GM and demanded some money back. Still nothing and no accountability. What a bogus place. Words of advice: stay at the Hilton. This place shouldn't be open to the public. It's easier to just flush your money down a toilet.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely The Best Hotel The Cosmopolitan”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Everything was absolutely wonderful. The rooms beautifully decorated, clean, relaxing. They had relaxation cd in the room playing, washer and dryer in the room, complete kitchenette with dishwasher, plates, glasses and cookware. Our room had a flat screen tv in it and even ones in the elevators that played a relaxing DVD (sceens of moutains, etc.) great for people like me who are clostaphobic! The clerks were exceptional, very helpful, the wake up call was from a real live person! very nice. We can not wait to come back, some of the anmenities were not completed yet, but we are planning to come back in October, we will never stay at another hotel in Toronto.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic oasis”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just left the cosmopolitan , stayed there for one night. Fell in love with the place the moment we walked into the hotel. The rooms are big, We had a great room overlooking downtown Toronto, with The service was not noticeable, (which is good) but always there when you needed it, the sevice was great, and was a perfect end to our vacation. This was a fantastic oasis in a hectic city of Toronto. I cannot wait until we go back to Toronto, and without a doubt back to the cosmopolitan!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just arrived from this hotel today, and my wife and I enjoyed this hotel. The service was consistent from staff to staff. My wife utilized the life style manager to help us book a one day tour of Niagra Falls, and also received some other information about Toronto, in general. When we arrived at the hotel, our room did not have the advertised incense. After I asked for some incense, several staff went out of their way to help us get the incense. As far as the room itself is concerned, I really liked the decour of the room. The hardwood floors are very nice, the bed is a pillowtop and was very confortable for us to sleep in. The mini-bar was nice, with a nice romantic set-up. The bathroom was somewhat small, but it fit the overall presentation of the room. The only issue my wife had with the room was that it did not have enough space to unpack our clothes. The balcony was just ok, nothing special. The LCD"s televesion were --- nice, though the televisions only had one remote control. Considering the location of this location, my wife and I were rarely disturbed, except a few sirens (but hey what do you expect with a busy downtown like Toronto). The continental breakfast was nice, they had fruit, coffee, tea, muffins, banana bread, and a few other items. I would score the breakfast and A-. Overall, I would stay at this hotel again and recommend it to others.
